38935092.review:
Hidden Folks is a hidden object game, akin to the old Where's Wally books. Unlike the old Where's Wally books though, Hidden Folks doesn't have a recurring character, like Wally, that you need to find on each page. The game has a very nice atmosphere to it, and the gameplay is amazingly fun!

Hidden Folks does not copy the typical hidden object book/game in a lot of aspects though, sound has become a major part of the game, not being essential, but adding so much more personality to the game. All the sounds in the game can be reproduced by the mouth, giving it a very childlike feeling to it, which accompanies the feelings of nostalgia (for the old hidden object books) quite well. Along with the design of the characters possessing a hand-drawn aesthetic, this creates a very comforting world to find hidden people in! (quite child friendly, with the exceptions of a couple minor characters in the game). You can change the atmosphere of the game majorly by selecting different colours for the game to be in. You can choose the average white background, and black lines, a light brown tea-stained look, or black background with white lines. I personally like the light brown look better, as it is easier on the eyes, so your eyes can focus on more important things, such as finding hidden folks!

The gameplay is very much what you'd see in a hidden object book, such as Where's Wally, with a lot of differences, mainly the game does not try to blind you with colours such as many hidden object books at the time did (especially Where's Wally), instead many of the people you need to find can be found through interacting with the environment (ah, the wonders of video games!), as well as reading the hints of the listed characters/objects you need to find, which changes in every scene. The game shakes it up as you progress the level area change, from forests to deserts, and change in difficulty, from small little maps, to huge ones! Many of the hidden folks at first are quite easy to find, but eventually you'll have one left, and for the life of you, you still can't find them! This game provides quite the challenge sometimes! But the game never gets too frustrating, it's hard to stay too angry at such an adorable game!

In short, although there is not much to say about this game in general, most of the charm and fun of this game cannot be explained, more of have to be experienced. The real hidden object game is really Steam, and trying to find a game that is amazing, and this game is that hidden gem. A game that's so enjoyable that it even makes the credits fun to read!

38844388.review:
O jogo me prendeu a atenção desde o trailer, ganhei de presente e posso dizer que valeu muito a pena!

A proposta do jogo por si só é bem simples - encontrar elementos escondidos nos cenários. A execução dessa ideia simples, entretanto, é muito criativa: as ilustrações são bem feitas, as dicas são engraçadas sem entregar facilmente localizações, a interação com o cenário é divertida e o principal: a sonoplastia inteira do jogo é feita pela voz humana. Buzinas, pássaros, bolas de neve, pessoas, árvores e tudo mais ficam engraçadíssimos interpretados pelo dublador.

Tudo é muito bem feito e é possível ver o carinho da equipe que criou o jogo pela obra em cada detalhe. Pra mim funciona muito como um jogo de intervalo, de momentos de distração, e não funcionaria tão bem como algo que você rusha/se desespera pra terminar.

Dei muitas risadas, me senti satisfeita ao encontrar elementos minúsculos em cenários enormes e as conquistas são justas: encontrar todos, 100% dos itens "encontráveis".

Recomendo, é o melhor jogo com o qual me deparei na categoria de "objetos escondidos" e na sale tem desconto, claro :)

38803586.review:
Hidden Folks is not exactly a bad game but it is a disappointment. Everything I read about this game and everything people told me about it made it sound like it was Where's Waldo but for the modern era. It's not. I used to love hidden stuff books when I was a kid so this should have been perfect but the thing that those books had that Hidden Folks does not is simply visually interesting stuff. 

Let's try something: I want you to go to google and just search for a page out of a Waldo book. You don't even have to bother looking for the guy, just look at the pages. You'll quickly notice that they are full of gags and interesting stuff happening, things that are not related with Waldo at all but simply happening in the scene. It is dense with fun things to see because the creator of Waldo would start each scene with a list of jokes or other visually interesting things that he wanted to draw and THEN he'd put Waldo in the scene once he had an interesting setup to show. Hidden Folks doesn't do that nearly as often. Instead it hides those little interesting things (a lot of times not that interesting either) within a massive scene of mostly copy-pasted and just slightly tweaked assets meant to hide what you are looking for, nothing more. Old hidden stuff books had lots of fun things to look at outside the objects/characters you were meant to find, Hidden Folks just has mostly clutter and interactable things that hinder you. That's just a bummer when it could be so much more if they focused on scene composition rather than having huge, sprawling screens full of little guys doing this wavey motion with their arms. It's why the tiny puzzles within Hidden Folks work better than the rest, I think: Less repetition, more unique and interesting stuff.

Get it if you like finding random stuff but don't expect a ton of clever or amusing things outside the cute noises and kind of cute graphics.

38771320.review: I love the concept of this game. It's really cute and the sounds when clicking on items are amazing. I do enjoy the complexity of the interactions (such as moving rocks to uncover items, turning on computers to find clues), but there is a reason why people have such few hours spent on this game. It is ridiculously hard and yes I  mean ridiculously. You can get through some levels within a reasonable time and truly enjoy them, but then when you reach the snow/factory levels, it gets simply too complex. A lot of the clues are ambiguous and once you close a map to try another one, it won't "save it" in it's current state (apart from recognising which items you have found prior) - which will make you waste a lot of time repeating your old own actions. I wish completed zones or targets would become highlighted. I also wish that found items would be removed from the map. With all that being said, I simply can't recommend because it's very tedious, rather than a fun casual experience such as where is Waldo. I do hope more games like this will be available on steam in the future,

38742614.review: 10 out of 10 sound effects and outstanding voice acting

38728056.review:
If you're a diehard fan of hidden object games, then rejoice; someone made a game just for you, and this is it. 

Now, you may have found Waldo or any of a number of other clone characters during the Waldo/Wally craze in the '90s, but make no mistake: this game is NOT your old Where's Waldo. Martin Handford never went for this level of detail. Depending on your threshold for where detail gives way to far too much detail, that may be a good thing.

So what *is* Hidden Folks? It's a hidden object game, requiring you to seek out little people and objects in scenes that vary from small and simple to positlvely enormous and exceptionally detailed. There isn't a gradual ramp up, either, so expect to go straight from "hey, this is easy!" to "how am I going to find *ANYTHING* in this?!" in one step. But stick with it; while initially overwhelming, there's a lot of logical consistency in the scenes. Paying attention to the description of each person and item you're supposed to find and an eye for picking out context in the scenes serves you well. You can find your selected items just casting around randomly, but it will take just this side of forever.

This is a game where patience is a key element. If you're impatient, need things to happen quickly and regularly, and can't handle delayed gratification, this is not a game for you; boredom and frustration will reign in short order. But for true hidden object fans, this game is just about ideal.

So why "just about?" The artwork is first class, the puzzles creative and complete, and the environments are extremely interactive. Where's the gap? The audio. All of the sound in this game is vocalized sound effects, and there's not much of it. You will hear the same noises again and again until they grind themselves into your brain. Cute for the first couple minutes, grating from that point on. Turning off your PC's audio may well be in your future; it was here. 

Put together, the extremely impressive visuals far outweigh the nearly-infuriating audio by a wide margin, so this game still easily earns a thumbs-up recommendation. For the patient object hunter, this game is practically a love letter.

Playing this on a 3.3 GHz iMac, with the AMD Radeon R9 M395, El Capitan 10.11.6.

What a well made delight!  It is obvious that a lot of care & love went into this game.  Not only are the visuals a joy to experience, but the sound effects have to be heard to be believed!  You will find yourself clicking on items, not because they are one of the targets, but just to hear what kind of goofy squeak, howl, groan, gasp, hoot or growl they will emit.

At the start of each puzzle you are given a list of items to find, perhaps 8 or so.  Upon finding 6 of them, the game can give you the option of moving to the next puzzle, or staying on the one you are at.  I always found myself staying to find every single item just to get every drop of pleasure from each puzzle.

If you read the description of the game, and looked at the screenshots and were at all interested, then by all means pick up this game because it certainly delivers what it promises.

38639134.review:
You don't often get to use the word 'charming' to describe a game, but Hidden Folks is exactly that.

It's also fiendish.

It's an animated "Where's Waldo" with a clever sense of humor and a sadistic sense of style -- who knew there were so many ways to make very simple, very similar looking characters look [i]just[/i] that little bit different?

Even so, the frustration factor is very low.  There's enough going on to remain entertaining even while looking for that elusive last object.

Best of all: no clock.  Take your time, wander through the drawings, enjoy the "sound effects" (all 'mouth-originated', as the website says).

 This is very much the kind of game where you'll sit down for a "quick poke through" at seven, look at the clock ten minutes later, and wonder why it's a quarter to twelve.  Definitely [b]Recommended[/b].

*bling* Wieder etwas gefunden. Das Spiel strotzt nur so vor vielen liebevollen und witzigen Details. Da wäre die sehr schön gezeichneten Karten auf denen es auch abseits der zu suchenden Personen und Objekte allerhand zu entdecken gibt. Vieles lässt sich aktivieren oder verschieben. Der Sound ist noch das i-Tüpfelchen, fast alle Objekte, die man anklickt haben einen individuellen tlw. sehr witzigen Soundeffekt. 

Das Suchen der Objekte und Personen artet nicht in ödes Klicken aus, auch wenn man einiges auch zufällig entdecken kann, sondern es gibt für alles einen Hinweis, der zumindest erahnen lässt, in welcher Ecke der Karte man das Gesuchte finden könnte. Gerade bei den großen Karten eine ernorme Erleichterung oder wenn man erst einmal etwas aufdecken muss. Dabei hatte ich schon oft einen Aha-Effekt und musste das ein oder andere Mal schmunzeln auf Grund der kreativen Ideen.

Auch nach Release werden noch neue Karten kostenlos hinzugefügt, das gibt natürlich nochmal ein dickes Plus.

38571940.review:
I've completed 3 sets of map so far. I agreed with a friend while streaming that this game is perfect to relax thanks to hand drawn animated arts and these cute sounds. It makes people smile, well unless you look for Johny for half an hour (Yeah no Shining there). Well that just says about the game design it is not an simple "Where is the Waldo?" kinda book, but it is neither hard.

It is presented in such a way with move/cut mechanics and riddles that it is really enjoyable time. Also it is the perfect familly game. So yeah this game appeals to all the audience adults who wants some peace with educating value and to teenagers who will laugh and have goofy time.

Do I have any reason to reject  Hidden Folks? Nope. It's perfect hidden object game with reasonable challenge. It contains a charming adventure in each set of map.

38429502.review:
Onde está Wally? Em lugar nenhum aqui, mas enquanto ele não parece temos dezenas de outras figuras curiosas para encontrar.
Eu sempre adorei Wally com as ilustrações imaginativas enormes- alguém teve a genial idéia de fazer o mesmo numa versão viva, animada e interativa. É o mesmo conceito mas ao invés de encontrar 1 objetivo para você deve encontrar vários, quase todos estão completamente escondidos.
A maioria é simplesmente clicar em algo que revela momentaneamente o nosso procurado mas alguns casos são mais criativos onde se interage com uma coisa que muda outra onde agora o procurado pode ser revelado.

Desafio? Existe algum, um pouco, apenas em quanto tempo você leva- eventualmente qualquer um encontra tudo.
Mas Hidden Folk não é sobre desafio.
É uma relaxante brincadeira onde cada momento e cada clique é uma pequena surpresa que certamente traz sorrisos. O mais impressionante é o nível de cuidado e criatividade com tudo, cada personagem e coisinha, cada um fazendo alguma coisa- tanto que a graça maior está em explorar tudo do que encontrar os procurados; Na verdade encontrar todos os objetivos termina a fase e chances são você não terá visto tudo o que é outro ponto positivo, dando alguma re-jogabilidade.

Eu jogo pouco mas nunca desinstalo; O motivo é simples: eu quero que o jogo dure mais e o guardo para os momentos que estou mais triste, cansado ou ansioso porque é garantia que saio da experiência mais leve.
Vale cada centavo do valor completo, não existe nada igual - e tem atualizações gratuitas!

38358244.review:
[h1]장점(특징)[/h1]
[b]1. 아기자기한 힐링게임[/b]
간간히 유머들도 숨어있어서 피식할정도의 즐거움을 줍니다.
그리고 모든 소리가 입으로낸 소리란 것도 재미있네요.

[b]2. 적절한 힌트[/b]
힌트가 좀 모호하지만 추리하는 재미가 있네요

[b]3.추가컨탠츠 지원[/b]
2017년 12월달에도 3스테이지가 추가되었군요.

[b]4.정식 한글화[/b]
폰트도 잘 어울려서 불편함없이 즐길수있었네요.

[h1]단점[/h1]
[b]1.아쉬운 이미지[/b]
독특하고 아기자기한 감성은 인정합니다만 너무 단순해서 "월리를 찾아라"수준의 자세하게 이것저것 찾아볼 가치가 있다는 느낌까지는 주질 못합니다.
모든 스테이지가 색이 없다보니 어딜가든 허전한 느낌이고 사물간 구분이 잘 안가는 경우가 많습니다.
그리고 대부분의 캐릭터가 비슷하게 생기다보니 심심한 느낌도 더 커집니다.(개인적으로는 이부분이 가장 아쉽더군요.)

대부분 캐릭터나 사물들이 복사되어 숫자로 커버한지라 나중에는 즐겁게 관찰하기보다는 클리어를 위해 화면을 연타하고있게됩니다.

[b]2.구분이 안되는 이미지들[/b]
위의 단점에서 이어지는거기도하지만 그림이 낙서같은 느낌 + 오밀조밀한 상태로 만들어진 탓에 작은 사물들의 경우는 무슨 모양인지 이해자체가 어려운 경우가 자주있습니다.

[h1]총평[/h1]
장르의 특수성을 무시할수는 없는지라 느긋하게 "월리를 찾아라"풍의 그림찾기를 즐기고싶은 분이라면 권할만한 게임입니다...다만 큰 기대는 버리고 접하길 권합니다.
가성비가 크게 나쁜건 아니지만 아직까지도 볼륨이 좀 적다는 느낌이 듭니다.

38321194.review:
Ein sehr schönes Wimmelbildspiel der etwas anderen Art.
Pro "Bild" (das sehr klein  oder mehrere Bildschirmseiten groß sein kann) sucht ihr diverse Personen und Gegenstände ohne Zeitdruck. Um manche Dinge zu finden, muss man erst mit der Umgebung interagieren - d. h. z. B. eine Tür öffnen oder etwas an oder aus machen.
Mir gefallen der Zeichenstil und das "schwarz/weiß" Design sehr gut - die Soundeffekte beim anklicken div. Personen und Objekte sind witzig und passend.
Alles in allem ein sehr stimmiges Spiel mit Spielspaß für ca. 10 Stunden bis man alle Bilder durch hat (inkl. Snow Update).
Ich würde dieses Spiel wieder kaufen und gebe eine klare Kaufempfehlung für Leute, die gerne "suchen".. :-)

38318780.review:
One of my favorite game of this year, coming back to it for the Snow update reminded me how relaxing this game is. 

If you like books with super elaborate drawings with a lot of details in every corner where you discover new things everytime you look at it (think Where's Wally? but better), then this game is for you. You can feel the game is crafted with a lot of love by the two devs, everything is hand drawn, full of super cute sound effects made by mouth, funny references and interesting details. 

Also don't be scared by the black and white color scheme if you think it's gonna be hard on your eyes, you can change it in the options for something less bright :) 

Definitely recommending this game, it's well worth the price :)

这款游戏的乐趣可能不只是寻找和搜索。

I've played plenty of hidden object games and none were as fun or intelligent as Hidden Folks.
First off, this game makes a lot more sense than the ones with fancy artwork that ask you to find tons of irrelevant items.
Secondly you have clues from the start, the difficulty is the fact that majority of the images are giant. This also prevents you to find objects by clicking everywhere blindly.
Thirdly, to find some people or objects in the game you have to solve little puzzles that are integrated within the image, and not some irrelevant puzzle game.

On top of all these, the artwork and sounds are super cute. Definitely buy this.

38270564.review:
There's good and bad aspects to this game. I wouldn't recommend it, but everyone has a different taste, so to each their own if this is something that you're really for. 

Good: 
- interactive and has sounds for just about every click you do
- nice artwork style
- big time killer if you really focus
- simple menu and game style
- keeps to the classic 'where's waldo' concept

Bad: 
- maps get huge
- very hard on the eyes. It's in pure black and white, with small details. Even if you zoom in, it's still quite difficult in some of the maps. (Looking at you 'Dry Lands')
- no clues
- gets boring quickly
- unlike Waldo, you do have to move objects around to find what you're looking for. Normally, that'd be totally cool, but the maps are so large that you can't possibly move every item
38270564.developer_response:
Thanks for your review! I wanted to point out a couple of things which could make you change your mind (maybe):

- the game has different color modes which make it easier for your eyes. (Sepia and Night mode)
- there ARE clues. If you click on a target at the bottom, you get a clue.
- if you focus on the clues, it'll become easier to know what to tap on in many cases. that might make the map 'smaller', so to speak. I agree that mindless clicking everywhere isn't fun, but the clues are exactly what is supposed to fix that.

Anyway, I hope that helps!

38014323.review:
This is purely a hidden object game, similar to something like "Where's Waldo?" except that finding some of the people/objects involves multiple actions on your part before they become visible.

To be honest, I was a little disappointed with this game, at first. The Forest levels weren't my favorite. However, I really got into the swing of things as the searchable areas increased in size and complexity. The Factory levels were downright devious, in some cases requiring your to figure out what various buttons and levers did in order to activate things in the correct order to reveal the object or person you needed to find. I tried to avoid looking at walkthroughs (and felt super proud of myself for getting through the City levels without once looking up solutions), but the second-to-last Factory level had four items that defeated me. I could have sworn I'd gone over the entire picture inch by inch, pressing everything, but I somehow still managed to miss stuff.

The game doesn't really have anything that could be called a story, but if you pay close attention you'll notice that various people and items from previous levels appear in later levels. In one level, you have to find the kayaker who just got back from a long trip. In an earlier level, I noticed that there was a car with a kayak on it - probably the kayaker heading home. Then there are the monkeys. At least one shows up on most (all?) levels. I also spotted people in one level with party balloons, who were probably the same people attending the birthday party in a later level.

I got this slightly on sale and, in the end, was happy with my purchase. It was challenging and enjoyable.

Pros:
+ Has a good difficulty range. It's not necessary to find all the people/objects in order to unlock the next level, and finding just enough of the items on your list to do that isn't too hard. The game becomes fiendishly difficult if you want to complete the entire level.
+ Each person/object you have to find comes with a little description that gives you a clue as to where you might find them.
+ It's fun to click on things just to see what they'll do.

Cons:
- A little hard on the eyes if you play too long. There are three display settings: black lines on a white background, white lines on a black background, and sepia background. Those might help some folks, but I generally stuck with black lines on a white background. One thing that took me an embarrassingly long time to figure out was that I could zoom in using my mouse wheel. That helped tremendously on the larger levels.
- Some of the "hidden folks" you have to look for look an awful lot like a dozen other folks on the screen (*ahem* Shopper Walid). Their clues won't always help you narrow your search down much. Be prepared to do some slow, careful, and possibly frustrating hunting if you plan on finding everything on the list for each level.
- The graphics were a little messed up in one of the City levels. Some of the people were only partially visible. This didn't inferfere with finding any of the people and objects on the list, though.

37942540.review:
If you enjoyed searching for Waldo, you're going to enjoy this game. However, there is no easily identifiable character like Waldo; instead, each area has a list of people or things to find.  At first some are daunting, both due to the size of the areas and due to the size of the items (golf ball, for example).  However, each item to find comes with a clue and the clue points to a bigger thing to search for.  For example, one item to find is a mushroom and the clue is that a pig is about to sniff it out.  So instead of looking for a little mushroom, you can look for a much bigger hog.  In fact, I was never stuck on an area due to the smallest items, and the couple times I did get stuck a little, I just wasn't seeing what was right in front of me.  In fact, in addition to the verbal clues, there are auditory clues.  I didn't discover this until the last few areas when I heard someone crying out in distress and looked for the source of the sound, but it's a nice feature.  

There are two really unique aspects to the game that add oodles of charm.  First, the game sounds are all done with the human mouth.  Some are definitely more effective than others.  I think the birds flying away sound is pretty weak, but I'll never get tired of the alligators or vultures or garage doors.  That's the second unique aspect - you can manipulate the environment and, in fact, you need to in order to find things.  For example, opening doors or flipping switches or moving clouds out of the way or cutting bushes. It's so much fun!  

Each area feels unique even when it has the same unifying theme - like the factory.  There is a nice variety - some areas are small, some are huge, some are puzzles.  My personal favorite is the desert, because this game also has a great sense of humor.  For example, in the city there is a boss lady at the top of a skyscraper surrounded by bags with dollar signs on them. That made me laugh. I thought the factory was going to be boring, but it wasn't at all.  Best of all, once you complete the game, you get a message that the devs are going to continue to add more areas.  They added the factory areas about 4 months after they released the game.   I'm definitely looking forward to more. 

I have only two little criticisms.  Not everything you can click on makes a unique sound.  Lots of things do, but I'd love it if EVERYTHING did.  Secondly, at one point you're supposed to look for a sunbathing turtle that only vaguely resembles a turtle.  Small price to pay, in my opinion, for the quirky hand drawn art style, and that's the only instance I came across.  

As for replay value, you can reset your progress.  You also don't have to find everything in an area before being able to move on - just a certain number.  However, it is like Waldo in the sense that once you know where something is, you know where it is.  But so much time and care was put into making each area a cohesive whole with objects to find spread throughout in a way that encourages the player to scan and enjoy the entire area, that I wouldn't trade that for any sort of randomization. Even if you only play through this game once, I think it's well worth the full price.  Personally, I love it so much, I'm sure I'll be back and I will instabuy anything else put out by this dev.  With so many slapped-together-to-make-a-quick-buck games on Steam, I definitely appreciate ones like this that are full of detail and heart.  I find myself smiling about parts of the game much later - like the ghost mail or those silly monkeys.  That's a rare find.

UPDATE - As promised, devs just added new snow areas.  Thank you!

37762256.review:
Hidden Folks est un jeu d'objet caché qui sort de l'ordinaire.
Avec un style graphique BD simpliste, une bande son pleine de bruitage qui vous immergera dans les différents univers de chaque tableau, Hidden Folks devrait vite vous convaincre.
Dans différentes scènes allant du désert à l'usine en passant par la jungle, vous aurez une liste de personnages et objets à trouver. Si certains sautent aux yeux, beaucoup necessite une ou plusieurs intéractions avec le décor ou des personnages existant pour être trouvés. Heureusement, chaque personnage/objet à trouver dispose d'un indice pour orienter vos recherches. Les bruitages ne sont pas anodins, certains sont des indices pour trouver un personnage ou autre. Notez que certains tableaux sont bien plus grand que ce que peut afficher votre écran, ce qui complique les recherches. Ajoutez à cela que le tout est animé, certains personnages parcourant tout le tableau.... Vous comprendrez vite que la difficulté est parfois au rendez vous (mais pas systématiquement, ce qui rendrait le jeu agassant).
La durée de vie reste assez courte, quelques heures tout au plus... c'est bien dommage, mais peut-etre verons nous quelques nouveaux tableaux apparaitrent. 
En bref, un jeu distrayant, une petite récré au milieu des gros jeu. A tester pour les amateurs du genre ou d'énigme. 
Un conseil, gardez bien grand ouverts vos yeux et vos oreilles!

37740975.review: I think the game is simple enough that it speaks for itself -- it's a "Where's Waldo" (Wally)-esque puzzle game where you look at huge open world drawings and attempt to find a series of objects within them. The aesthetics are black and white line work and the audio is cute. I think this is a really great realization of the premise, at about 3-4 hours worth of content I think the price is fair. The one thing I'd add is that this probably targets an age range slightly above Where's Waldo, since it's somewhat difficult relative to those books. The developer was and continues to be responsive to issues and has updated the game with free add-on content, so I think you can also feel pretty good supporting this small team.

This seemed like such a nice idea, but unfortunately for me the game got repetitive very fast. The later areas are large and there's lots to explore, as long as you don't mind clicking yet another tent/bush/door and finding nothing of interest. The hidden folk are distinguished by very small details and many of the objects are tiny. This can be either a welcome challenge for a hidden object fanatic or very annoying. I can see kids being entertained, playing this together, and in that case the game can have a lot of replay value. Otherwise you need quite a bit of zen to enjoy this game.

37371459.review:
Casual yet challenging, Hidden Folks is like a Highlights magazine for adults. There are several settings and 4-5 maps for each (along with an associated achievement). For each map you're given a list of objects to find; the size of the list is dependent on the size of the map. Each hidden object has a hint, which is useful for the extremely large maps. The very-obviously-manmade sound effects are amusing.

Pros: self-paced, challenging, good sound
Cons: no replayability (hopefully they'll add more maps?)

37368490.review: Ręcznie rysowane, ustami nagrywane... Mała rzecz, a cieszy. Naprawdę pozytywne zaskończenie.

37366531.review:
Это шедевр залипательности. Огромные локации, заполненные существами, которые живут своей увлекательной жизнью. Кучи пасхалок типа походной палатки со скелетом. Возможность разрывать ямы, открывать занавески и убират мешающие кусты. Глаза разбегаются.
И среди всего этого, очаровательно нарисованного и анимированного, нам надо находить персонажей, описанных и показанных в задании. И часто это требует и логики, и наблюдательности. 
Единственное, что огорчает - задачи для поиска не генерятся из списка, они всегда одни и те же. А так приятно было бы для разнообразия поискать в городе например хиппи, узнать имя того странного парня на крыше или вспомнить, где попадалась бабушка.

Fun game to jump into if you have a few minutes to spend and chill with.  Like other people say, it is like an interact Where's Waldo? but in black and white with multiple characters and objects to search for.  
The sound effects are quarky but make the game more enjoyable.  The level of interaction makes the game also enjoyable, from shaking a character out of a tree to scaring an animal out of its hole but clicking on it.
This probably won't be the type of game you'll play for hours straight but if you want something you can play for about fifteen minutes before you have to go do something else, I would highly recommend this one.

At one point, I clicked on a car a bunch of times just to hear the various "meep meep" noises. It would be nice to see some sort of random generated searches, as the hidden items don't change on multiple playthroughs. Overall a really nice game to unwind after a long day, or a game to play if you only want to spend 30 minutes having fun.

36866480.review:
This game seemed like another hidden object game, to mindlessly poke at every corner until you stumbled across one by some deduction or luck.

But the sheer amount of other interactables, while mostly not tied to the actual object, kept me from thinking 'meh, where is this thing?" and I got more fun out of poking the entire map's worth of stuff and listening to the fun sound effects or little animations.  Finding the things were more of a pleasant and fun surprise after that.

I refused to look at a walkthrough for the last few objects, despite how small they are, since exploring the environment they made is fun as it.

36352723.review:
I received this game as a birthday gift from a friend, and I must say, I thoroughly enjoyed it. I grew up playing hidden picture games such as I SPY and Where's Waldo, and I still play the genre to this day with many titles I find on sites such as Big Fish Games. That being said, this game held my expectations and placed it beyond. Hidden Folks is cheerful, fun, and great to play when you need to pass the time. The graphics are simple, yet really hold their own personality, and each level is carefully crafted to bring forth a masterpiece in every pixel, while making each feel entirely different to not bore the player. At 5 hours of playtime, it's short, but will have you searching for more. I highly reccomend this game if you enjoy hidden picture games as much as I do.



[b] Pros [/b]
 [*]Four hand-drawn areas to explore, each with around 3-5 levels to play
 [*]Various level interactions that help the levels feel more alive
 [*]Voice-produced sound effects that are cheerful and really fit in with the game
 [*]Achievements that are easy to earn and actually feel rewarding
 [*]A progress reset button for when you want to start over

[b] Cons [/b]
 [*]Later levels feel a bit too challenging. I had to use a walkthrough for the factory levels. Not a major complaint.
 [*]Game is a bit short, but it's not a huge deal. 
 [*]$8 seems a bit much for this game, but it's a personal nitpick. 

I highly suggest buying this game whenever you can. It's fun, somewhat challenging, and very pleasing to play, whether you're a hidden object fan or not. If this game is on sale, or you have a coupon, pick this up if you can. You won't be disappointed.

36208085.review:
Playtime: 3 hours, 100% achievements (would be much longer without following guide when stuck)

[h1]Overview[/h1]
Hidden Folks is a relaxing, and at times challenging, hidden object game with a unique art style and cute details. 

The hand-drawn art style is visually appealing, and I found the detailed interactions fascinating, along with the sound effects. For example you can click on holes in the ground several times to "dig up" things, or click on crops to water them and grow different plants. These interactions, sometimes puzzle-like, kept the game fresh in each new section.

[h1]Thoughts on gameplay[/h1]
I am not a big hidden object game player, but it is straight forward: there is a list of objects you have to find to progress to following levels. The detail in the levels is simply stunning and apart from finding your objective items it was entertaining to look around and interact with the environment. 

My favourite thing to do in the later levels is opening the many window blinds and doors and looking into the Hidden Folks' lives - some are counting money, some are working the cubicle life, or jamming out to music... I forgot about the objective items at times and just explored!

Some objective items are very, very tiny, or difficult to see due to the black and white colour scheme, and I had to look up a guide at times. Owing to the unique art style I don't have gripes with that, but it could frustrate some players.

[h1]Additional thoughts[/h1]
Some of the hidden object games I've played had story, and after finding all the necessary items you could progress the story. Hidden Folks doesn't quite have a cohesive story, but each item you find has a short blurb and some entertaining backstory. This brings the world to life as the Hidden Folk you're asked to find isn't just the "person with the hat", it could be a flower vendor whose business is slowing down today due to a traffic jam. (With animated cars stopping in front of his flower stand and you have to wait for a gap in traffic to click on him!)

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Hidden Folks' art style is a pleasure to look at, and its levels are entertaining to interact with. Once again I have to mention its attention to detail - each character and item you find has an interesting blurb. 

However, I only recommend this at full price ($8.99 CAD) to people that want a hidden object game first and foremost. For players like me who just wanted to relax and enjoy the art, get it on a discount.

Lots of detail and love went into this one and I look forward to new levels in the future and will play them soon after they are released. I very much recommend this game! This game contains huge levels, with any number of fun and entertaining situations to explore. There is a high degree of interactivity with the characters and environments. I can't imagine the amount of work that's gone into this game. That said, there is one concern I have about the game: replayability.

After I beat the game, I thought I might go back and try again. I was surprised to find that all of the targets are the same. This is a huge problem. This game uses very distinct characters, descriptive clues, and clever hiding places to great effect. The downside is that upon replaying the game, you easily remember where the characters are, and finding them is no great challenge.

Hopefully in the future the developer will be able to make it so that random targets can be assigned, making new playthroughs more challenging and enjoyable.

34951738.review:
I haven't had the privilege of playing something this unique and fun in a while. It's very much 'Where's Waldo?' with a twist. Some folks might not like the color scheme but it's not as bad as you might think and it really in fact makes it much harder to find stuff sometimes because it forces you to look for certain clues instead of color recognition.

Concept is pretty simple. Each level has a starting area which is pretty small. These areas are to help you acclimate yourself to the mechanics of each upcoming level. So basically it shows you what you can interact with and what you can expect to have to do to find all the items or people. One place you might need to ruffle some trees to knock a banana out while in another you have to perform a slight puzzle with levers to get a conveyer belt to move something to activate something else to open an area to find a guy who was otherwise unreachable. Very interesting.

Along with fun mechanics and gameplay the sound design is just a wonder to listen to. Clicking on anything leads to a humorous interpretation of what the dev thinks it should sound like. From squishes to bleeps to boops they had some guy just record himself making the noises. I don't think anything was done with props. Just a guy making noises man. Brilliant.

The developers are actively updating this with new levels which is awesome and I'd even go as far as to pay for new DLC with tons of new levels or a way to procedurally generate levels or something. So, would I recommend? Fuc|< yes.

오프라인 서적과는 달리ㅋㅋ PC게임이라 제가 무얼 찾았는지 메뉴에 다 표시를 해주어 편했고 그림들이 꼬물꼬물 계속 움직이고 클릭하면 웃긴 효과음도 나와서 오래 보아도 지겹지 않아 좋았습니다.

난이도는 사람에 따라선 어려울수도 있겠지만 시간만 투자하면 대부분 찾을 수 있는 수준이라 생각합니다.

34672679.review:
Not gonna beat around the bush, its basically an animated Wheres Waldo/Wally game. Thats not a bad thing either, I love the art style, its simple but complicated at the same time. Theres loads of things going on in every scene, just if you look around close enough and poke in the right places theirs some hidden characters. The gameplay mainly revolves around you searching for items and characters in the various scenes, however, every once in a while their is the odd puzzle map, and though they are simple, it's a nice break to the gameplay. The game is short, I completed all the levels in around 2hrs, although their still is some items for me to go back and find. So the $9 price tag might put some people off. In conclusion, this is definitely not a game for everyone, its got good charm and I do think this is one of the better hidden object games, and if you are a fan of those or are looking for something a little more chill, this may interest you. However if you do not like this style of game, I dont think this is the one thats going to change your mind.

34540366.review:
Hidden Folks is a hidden object style of game where you look through black & white populated areas for people & objects hidden in the natural habitat that is either the jungle, desert or city.

[u]The Good >>> The Identity:[/u]

All the sounds made in the game are “Human Babble” or “Mouth Generated” (whichever one makes more sense). For example, if you were to interact with a vehicle, you would hear someone saying “Meep Meep!” or even a crocodile, you’ll hear someone saying “Roar!”.

There aren’t any common WAV sound effects, like the generic ones used in today's games, being used in this game and the choice of sound effects being used gives it it’s own identity & charm.

[u]The Bad >>> The Potential:[/u]

The areas, or stages, in the game all vary in sizes, from a small place that fits your computer screen to a massive one that you can easily get lost in. There is one downside to all this and that is the quantity. There’s only 18 areas in the game.

There’s the option that the developers could think about doing and that is integrating Steam Workshop into the game. See what the steam community can conjure up.

Although the quantity is low, the developers have been at work adding new levels. In fact, through a August 27 news post, they’re planning on adding new areas with their “Android Update”.

[u]The Ugly >>> The Mess:[/u]

Playing the game, there were times where I noticed a few characters covered or hidden behind doors or other objects. A case where the orientation has a few “hiccups”, if you will. There are times when the things your looking for are covered on purpose, but this is where a layer is not supposed to overlap another.

To any other game, this would be a bad case of nitpicking, but for this game, where you’re looking for hidden people & objects, this is something that can be problematic.



The unique style to the game and the lack of actual flaws to this game makes it a no-brainer for me to recommend. Maybe the only sort of complaint that I can think of from other comsumers is a lack of color, but those people would be missing out.

34511512.review: Des maps qui deviennent de plus en grandes où il est possible de jouer avec le zoom. Il arrive qu’on se perde, mais ça reste toujours amusant. Les graphismes sont vraiment chouettes. Les petits indices pour trouver les éléments racontent une petite histoire (ex : il attend que la musique se lance, mais ne dansera pas), plutôt que de simplement nous indiquer un lieu. Il y a aussi quelques scènes sympathiques où il faut juste aider un personnage à progresser à travers la map pour accéder au prochain niveau. Pouvoir interagir avec des éléments pour trouver les objets apporte un plus (ex : couper des plantes, faire pousser des plantes, tourner des paraboles, bouger des voitures, pousser des plaques d’égout, ouvrir les rideaux, etc). Je pense que le point fort du jeu est les bruitages, réalisés avec leur propre voix (vraiment très drôle t’entendre leur prononciation des lettres dans le dernier niveau !).  On ne se lasse pas de cliquer un peu partout pour entendre les bruitages. Hâte qu’il y ai d’autres niveaux !

Great casual fun that appeals to the Sergio Aragonés part of my psyche.  I'm good with the price just for the art style alone, which is fabulous.  And the interactions are amusing and pleasing.  The sounds effects are novel and still funny.  On the larger maps, the search can at first seem overwhelming... but it never turns out to be.  It's a "drink it all in with your eyes" kind of thing... look around and investigate the map before searching and you'll get more out of it.  Should you come to a real stumper, there's help out there. 

Now that I've completed the game over 4 or 5 casual play sessions, I would like more...  a lot more.  Here's an instance of where I'd gladly throw money at DLC.  Hopefully this game has a long life with many additions.

34171848.review:
首先，这个游戏，它，它不是个拿来放松的游戏啊！！！这是个会让人崩溃的游戏啊！！！一共有17张图，写这篇测评的时候我是玩到第十张图。比起一口气通关，这游戏大概是更适合有空翻出来玩玩的类型，
[b]关于玩法[/b]
并不能说是单纯的找东西考眼力。每个需要找的东西都会给提示，然而并不是有了提示就很容易找到。比如根据提示可以知道要找的兔子在洞里，但是事实上整张图里会有好多的兔子洞，还是得一个一个找过去。但可以肯定的是不看提示真的很难找。可以互动的东西非常多，尽管没什么意义，但随便戳也是挺有趣的。游戏大概是一张大图一张小图穿插的形式，大图真的是大且杂乱到令人崩溃的程度，而让玩家找的东西，呃，比如说一根香蕉，甚至可能藏在篮子里，小到必须放大了才能看到。画面只有黑白二色更是为这个游戏增加了难度。所以这款游戏真的很能消磨时间，也很需要耐心。
[b]关于音效[/b]
把画面挪动到一些发出声音的地点或者点击交互的时候都会有音效，而音效都是由人模仿那些生物或物件的声音。纯人声可以说是非常有特色了。又相似又能听出是由人模仿的，很有意思。没有BGM却不会让人觉得单调，音效为这个游戏加分不少。
[b]关于画面[/b]
画风和这个游戏给人的感觉一样风趣可爱。游戏分为森林旱地城市工厂四个章节【？】，虽然全程黑白，但是每个场景给人不同的感受都已能传达到。游戏还提供了不同的颜色模式，分别是黑线条白底，黑线条奶黄色底，白线条黑底。这个功能我玩到后来才发现……还是相当贴心的。从我个人而言后两种看着眼睛会轻松很多。
总结一下是一款略虐心的游戏。很有趣，但更适合有耐心的玩家。

33919775.review:
Absolutely adorable game! I really genuinely enjoyed it and cannot wait to see more levels. Its not timed and is very relaxing to me to play. I describe it to others as a really immersive Wheres Waldo? You use sight, touch (in the sense you interact with things), and sound to find the characters. The simple yet completely unique way this game works kept me playing. It never got boring!
I will admit it gets pretty challenging so if you are playing with children maybe stay on the earlier levels or keep a guide handy to help them. I had to look up one solution and a tip twice myself. The solution was for something with a hint like "3.15.4" (i know thats probably wrong sorry) because I really couldnt figure it out and the tip I needed was that if you think you know where something is but cant find it, just zoom in and stop moving for a minute. Sometimes your eyes need a minute to adjust and take in the thing that was blending in before.
I read some reviews before purchasing and I will have to say I strongly disagree with them! One said that the game gave them stress which it would have if it were timed but it is not so if it stresses you out then take a breath! You have all the time in the world and you do not have to pressure yourself to find absolutely everything in order to move on! Take it slow :). I think I am rambling at this point but that is because I am really happy about this game! It is SO GOOD!

Où est charlie en noir et blanc et dynamique !

Rien à redire sur ce très bon jeu.
Graphiquement épuré, il semble enfantin... les 2 premières zones. La complexité et la richesse des suivantes suffit à convaincre. Il est possible de rendre le fond blanc plus ou moins orange (voir inverser le monochrome) pour moins fatiguer les yeux.
Les personnages ou objet à trouver sont variés et les petits indicés disponibles aident grandement. Ils évitent également de trop se prendre la tête (ce qui n'est pas le but). 
Ce n'est pas un simple jeu d'objets cachés. C'est plus dynamique car rapidement il faut réaliser des actions pour déclancher ou découvrir les persos/objets. C'est plaisant.
Certains personnages sont très difficiles à trouver (merci les forums Steam) mais ne représentent qu'une poignée et ne viennent pas ternir le jeu.

Fini avec le sourire et hâte de voir la suite. A acheter (en plus pas cher !) pour soutenir cette belle équipe et s'amuser.

33713479.review:
[h1]Great relaxing game only spoiled by the very last level[/h1]

What a great game.  Very cool and very well done.  It's certainly not difficult, but I had fun!

You probably already know the game is somewhat of a "where's Waldo" in that you find objects hidden in an interactive and animated world, so I'll focus on just a couple things that helped me enjoy the game more...

I liked the game better once I understood how they were introducing the levels.  When they introduce a world the map is very small.  This is to show you how objects and characters in this world interact when being clicked on or dragged which shows you how to reveal the hidden objects you're looking for.  And these methods are very much needed on the following big maps.

I also enjoyed the game more when you [b]first click on the object[/b] to be found [b]to get a clue[/b] as to where it is; otherwise I was just clicking on everybody and everything and the game simply wasn't very fun this way.  But once I learned to first get the clue, then I could go and look for that specific item, and the game was MUCH better and much more rewarding.

The only problem I had with the game is the last "real level" of "Factory" which is both too big and the clues too vague.  I simply had to go to a walkthrough guide for that level.  So that ending level was not fun at all and really spoiled what was otherwise a truly fantastic game.

[h1]Despite the last level and the short-ish time to complete (~3.5 casual hrs), I still highly recommend picking this up.[/h1]

33697991.review:
Hidden Folks is a cute and playful game about finding tiny objects in gigantic maps full of things you can interact with. It's like Where's Waldo, but everything is moving, everything has to be searched, everything is chaotic and the maps can get really, REALLY huge and so finding that one tiny garden fork can take a whole lot of time.

I think I would've sold my soul to play something like this when I was younger. I loved looking for small details and so point and click was my favourite genre, but this game takes small details to a level so high that it can only be compared to finding a needle in a haystack - a really fun haystack, that is. You're given the map, you're given the targets, and each one has a small clue for their whereabouts. This is usually some sort of riddle or hint. And then all that remains is a whole bunch of opening windows, searching the crowds, looking in tents, pressing the buttons and even solving cool puzzles all to find a target that's just one of many. The 4 worlds with multiple maps in each will offer a whole ton of fun for a few hours, and even if that seems short for you, they're still adding more!

The minimalistic graphics are pretty charming and actually a great design choice as it adds more challenge to finding the targets. The full gorgeousness of this game can only be appreciated if you zoom out far enough, and then you stop noticing the hand-drawn sprites and start noticing the great level design. Every level seems like organized chaos if you look from far enough - it's sort of divided in sections, but they're spread out and overlapping in a way that it doesn't seem to systemized. If there'd be a whole lot of tents in a huge square and a square forest next to it, that'd be bland, but the game puts a few tents outside of their dedicated area, adds in different things between those tents, clearings in the forest, and a whole bunch of more chaos that makes finding targets that much more interesting. And also, there's an incredible amount of sprites and small details everywhere, making it far less boring. Adding to that, it seems that they've thought of everything - for example, I've seen games that depict suburbs as boring rows of houses. This game had a suburb and sure, some houses were kind of bland, but there was a pool party, a haunted house, a house where somebody was moving in, a yard sale, a house where people were playing golf, a supermarket and much, much more. This helped them make levels that were unbelievably large, but at the same time, they never felt boring and they never seemed like the same thing repeating over and over again.

If you couldn't tell from the trailer, the sound design consists solely of sound effects done with voice acting only, which adds a very playful and childlike feel to the game. The sound was also used cleverly as a tool that can sometimes be used to find targets. For example, if you have to find a monkey in a lab, you can move around until you hear monkey sounds, which indicate that it's not far away. I understand why some people would find the sound effects annoying, but I personally thought they managed to fit in with the atmosphere just fine.

For fellow completionists - this game gives you achievements for finding all targets. It doesn't take too long and it's extremely fun to do.

Overall, I think the game's rating speaks for itself, and, even though it's very short, it definitely is very good, and even if a few (but very fun) hours of gameplay seem like not enough, you should at least get this on sale - you won't regret it.

33635387.review:
It's hard to think of something to say about this game that is accurate without just listing bullet points - so that's what I did.

I guess two things that come to mind are "kitchy" and "charming."  Another two are "infuriating" and "distracting."  I think, if you're a HOGger, there's a unique experience for you here.

In the HOG genre, I give this an 8 +1 for interactability as a puzzler; it's inventive, unique, and engaging, appropriate for all ages, with an increasing complexity as the scenes progress.  A parent or sitter could easily sit with an inquisitive child and have fun just looking around the scenes.

Pros:
-Family-compatible game, rated G.
-Amusing sound effects (children and college students will like this).
-You can click on all the things to see what they do - and some must be moved/manipulated to reveal hidden objects.
-All hidden objects/characters give click-on clues to help locate them.
-List price is less than a single admission to a movie.
-Steam trading cards.
-Steam achievements.
-Dev gives option at game completion to join email list for future release notes.
-Auto-save at exit.
-Can reset all areas 100%.
-Do NOT need to 100% any scene in order to progress (but there is a minimum per scene needed to progress).

Cons:
-If you want a fast 100% achi, guess again (though there are some very good guides).
[i]-Could not find Waldo.  [u]Sadness.[/u][/i]

하는 생각을 하며, 이 게임의 모든 업적을 클리어 하고, 마지막 스테이지까지
끝내고 난 뒤의 만족감은 생각보다 크지는 않지만, 미소를 짓게 하기에
매우 충분했습니다.

알맞은 난이도와 눈은 좀 아프겠지만, 유쾌한 효과음들이
이 게임을 끝까지 즐길 수 있도록 도와줬습니다.

게다가 지속적으로 스테이지 업데이트도 해준다고 하니,
이 정도 가격에 상당한 만족을 얻을 수 있었습니다.

여러분도 이 숨은그림찾기 장르의 상당한 수작이라 할 수 있는
HIDDEN FOLKS를 해보시는 건 어떠신가요?

진심으로 추천드립니다.

33547040.review:
Hidden Folks is a fun videogame version of Where's Waldo, more or less.

Pros:

- Attractive art style.
- Endlessly amusing sound effects.
- Funny and occasionally challenging.

Cons:

- Finding certain object targets can be a bit difficult which could frustrate players who aren't all about Hidden Object games. Hints are provided for each target and players may need to learn to read between the lines to hit these goals.

Overall, Hidden Folks is a very fun casualish game. I'm mostly not a fan of the Hidden Object genre but I always loved Where's Waldo. While not directly related to Waldo, the game provided a fun diversion down memory lane.

33408810.review:
UPDATE DEC. 2017: The snow update features new delightful areas with the same charm and excellent sound effects as the previous ones. I would say they add around 1 hr of content to the game.

If I had to summarize [i]Hidden Folks[/i] in one word it would be "delightful".

[h1]General impressions[/h1]
[i]Hidden Folks[/i] is a hidden object game that stands out due to its charming hand-drawn artwork and fun soundtrack — made up entirely of human voices! Every click produces a sound, be it the [i]"vwooooshh"[/i] of opening a curtain or the [i]"beep bop"[/i] of clicking a robot or my personal favorite: the [i]"AAARRRGGHHHKJLKLKD"[/i] of clicking a vulture in the desert level — seriously, it gets me every single time.

The sum of all these elements brings to life an amusing game that offers its hidden object aspects within layers of smooth animations, interesting clickable parts, ingenious level design and altogether top-notch humor. The cherry on top are the sagacious clues provided for each object to be found, and the pleasant sensation of figuring them out correctly after many twists and turns — something I felt accutely during the Factory Levels.

[h1]The settings[/h1]
The in-game settings deserve their own category in this review due to being so well thought-out. Your eyes won't bleed at night thanks to the ability to choose between three different themes: traditional black on white, white on black and a sort of "nude" color that resembles any book reader setting on your mobile phone. Plus, if you choose the default black on white, you can use a gray-scale slide so you can avoid that climbing-the-Everest-eye-burning-white-snow-of-death shade of white.

[h1]The updates and the devs[/h1]
The game is still constantly receiving updates! The latest major one, at the time of this review, was on the 15th of June adding 3 new HUGE levels, the factory levels. The devs are also keeping a close eye on the community, and often appear on the forums for a word or two on solving issues or thanking the helpful feedback.

I love the fact they shared with us several aspects of how the game is made in a news update celebrating the Factory Update. You can check them all out starting [url=http://steamcommunity.com/games/435400/announcements/detail/1332350869595068752]here[/url].

I was also pleased to 100% the game and be prompted to sign up with my e-mail to be notified of further updates. Keep me posted, guys!

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[i]Hidden Folks[/i] is a fairly-priced, wonderfully built and charmingly engineered hidden objects game. In its current form, it easily presents some [b]4-5 hours of gameplay[/b] for the eager and eagle-eyed. Even more for those who rather take their sweet time and relax, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/435400/discussions/0/135509124600971784/]as advised by the devs themselves[/url]. 

I strongly recommend this game to those who [b]seek brilliant artwork[/b], [b]appreciate a game with a good sense of humor[/b] and delight themselves with [b]tiny details and poking around with them[/b].

I would NOT recommend this game to people averse to patience or who get easily frustrated when presented with too much visual information at once. [i]Hidden Folks[/i] can grow easily frustrating if rushed and easily boring and purposeless if played only for an 100%.

33294460.review: I guess this IS a hidden object game, but I doubt it's much like the rest of the genre. Or at least, I assume so, as I've not played any other game that would meet that classification. This however, is much like an animated where's waldo. The hand drawn graphics and vocalized sound effects lends this game a unique charm. Overall the game is a good difficulty, I only got purely stumped once or twice. Once you learn that the environment can be interactive, the possibilities for hiding spaces really opens up. Still, don't expect any gameplay other than searching for little doodled people. If you go in with that expectation though, you'll find this is more fun than any where's waldo book you've ever used. I also enjoyed the updated content that came out well after the game's release. It's always nice to see a developer throw in some extras down the line.

33263555.review:
This is a very good hidden object game.

It ought to be worth several hours of poking around.  Some scenes are easy, and some are very large with some items taking a good bit of effort to find.  I wouldn't have thought that all the sound effects being vocal noise would be good, but it's quite well done.  And those scenes can be quite interactive, mostly in obvious ways, and there's plenty of things to come across that aren't on the list of objects to find.  Plants to grow or chop down, holes to poke at, Xs to dig up, most things to open, many things to move around.

I particularly like that each object has its own hint, and they're the creative sort rather than just pointing you to where it is.  I found it can still be tough to figure out some of them.  I cleared the first two areas in three hours, of the four areas, but each area is getting more scenes and more large scenes.  No time pressure or other gimicks either, just searching around the map at your leisure.

If you enjoy the hidden object puzzles, I strongly recommend this one.  There should be several hours worth of poking around.

33261083.review: This is the ideal mix of zen fiddling and brain-engaging. Despite its monochromatic line art it manages to imbue a lot of personality into its sometimes massive panoramas. The sound effects alone are worth the price of admission.

33237803.review:
This game is a lot of fun if you grew up searching for Waldo as a kid. The hand drawn art and scenes are very well done - just enough detail to make the maps seem large but not enough to make it feel daunting. The gameplay is as simplistic as you'd think... just a lot of shifting around, trying to figure out what the clues provided mean, and the occasional, frustrated clicking spasm.

I love that all of the sounds in the game are made by voice as well; really fun, interesting touch! :)

I had a couple friends over and wanted to show them the game, so I loaded it up on my TV and we hunted together for a bit. It was pretty fun as there's so much on screen at any given moment that it can sustain the attention of multiple people's eyes.

I'd definitely spend a couple bucks on this experience just because of how solid of a reminder of my youth it was!

33235647.review:
[h1]YUmeizi的购买过程[/h1]

首先引用一下steam玩家“Mikasa·Ackerma”的评测
[quote=Mikasa·Ackerma] 假如海伦凯勒有三天光明，希望她别碰到这游戏。[/quote]

在手绘风，可互动的微观风景插画中寻找隐藏其中的家伙。卷起帐篷，劈砍树丛，开关大门，甚至戳戳鳄鱼！哇咔咔咔咔！

作为indie游戏爱好者，[spoiler] 以及一位深度手残自虐患者[/spoiler]，YUmeizi当然不会错过这款火爆了基友圈的游戏。

本游戏发行之后直到夏促期间，YUmeizi因为工作繁忙，几乎没有上过Steam，险些就错过了这么一款精品的[spoiler]自虐[/spoiler]游戏。

很幸运地，YUmeizi在本次steam夏促中获得了基友的安利，最开始是基友群里找不到要素时的求助，画风是这样的------

假装有图1

这样的------

假装有图2

以及这样的------

假装有图3

还有这样的------

假装有图4

23333333

怎么样？是个很可爱很用心的休闲游戏吧？

闲话少说，关于一些游戏的基本内容，建议各位小伙伴购买，夏促期间只要[strike]31[/strike]→23元

这篇文章主要是阐述YUmeizi对本游戏的一些体验和直观感受，并且奉上全关卡要素的攻略。

[h1]YUmeizi的直观感受[/h1]

画面：手绘风的画面简直大爱啊，呆萌的小鸡啊，蠢萌的人物啊，以及画出了灵魂深处的孤独的猴王。满满的加分点啊。

音效：京中有善口技者！----咪咪咪！哞哞！咩！滴滴！

犹记得打开游戏之后第一次点击时，旁边刷着日番的妹子一脸诧异看着我的表情，然后基本不玩游戏的妹子就开始了与我的二人的眼瞎寻宝之路。完全是音效的功劳啊。

关卡设计：真心觉得满分，寻找要素的提示和游戏中的互动特别完美，然而其中有写有问题的翻译还是有错误的，好像沙漠中找装满金子的桶，中文翻译一塌糊涂，提示完全是错的。

总之，“大家来找茬”这种；类似的休闲indie游戏就是我的菜，[spoiler]毕竟手残党玩不了什么大作！[/spoiler]

8/10，两分是眼睛扣掉的。

[h1]YUmeizi的全关卡通关攻略[/h1]

因为图片过多，拆分按大章节做了4篇，点击下方进入

请注意！攻略大量剧透！如还相信自己的眼睛，请坚持自行寻找！

33094171.review:
For those who grew up with and loved the Where's Waldo books, this is a pleasant interactive iteration. It's challenging enough that you can't find the characters and objects right away, but with the hints the more complex puzzles are also not that impossible to figure out.

The sprites and sound effects are funny and well made, and the levels are very good and it's noticeable that a lot of thought went into their creation, especially when it comes to the visual storytelling.

Overall it's a very enjoyable game and is a nice scratch to that seek and find itch.

33093121.review:
Short review for Hidden Folks just for those looking to pick it up in the sale.

It's a solid 6/7 out of 10, thats because I don't really like this genre, its a bit too casual for me. As a hidden object game though it was VERY clever and I enjoyed the humour throughout. It's worth buying in a sale or a bundle.

I will definitely recommend it though as the devs have committed to adding content, even when you finish they ask if you want them to email you when more content is added, big thumbs up to the devs for this!

The noises I loved, however after a while they went from cute, to funny, to annoying, to "lets turn the sound off". The art style helped the puzzles. I have no arguments over the art, I loved its distinctive silly style.

The gameplay gets a 10/10, for a hidden object game this had a fair chunk of easy puzzles to solve which mixed the gameplay up JUST enough to keep it interesting.

Simple, relaxing, and funny. Hidden Folks is a nice re-envisioning of Where's Waldo, adding challenges of big and small maps. Game uses funny sounds actually done by a voice which actually add's humor to it.  The visuals are nice, and well drawn, and it's actually a good brain bending game.   Playing with more than one person actually add's to the fun and makes it more exciting to look and spot the items. At times, you can get a little bored, because it's really a simple design. 33049434.review:
[h1][url=store.steampowered.com/app/435400/Hidden_Folks/]Hidden Folks[/url] is a peculiarly unique entry in the hidden object genre, set in a fully hand-drawn world filled with cheerfully voiced sound effects.[/h1]

Each item to seek comes with a single clever hint to suggest its location. The game is better played by meticulously observing the environment and following this tip than by poking at any random thing.

Deciphering the hints and exploring the map is quite congenial since the world is filled with small surprises and amusing details, so even clicking on the wrong reactive target can be rewarding.

I expected more sequential puzzles, such as series of events to trigger in a specific order. For the most part, items are obtained with a single click, or never more than a handful (with a few exceptions). Making future areas more deeply interactive in upcoming updates would strengthen the game's solid but basic formula.

Maps range from incredibly tiny to overwhelmingly large. On the latter type, a few rare items can be barbarously difficult to find.

There is no pressure to complete challenges or timers to ruin the relaxing mood, making this the perfect game to play in small doses to wind down at the end of a day.

32946082.review:
Du magst Wimmelbilder? Dann bist Du bei dieser animierten und interaktiven Variante genau richtig.

Die detailreichen, handgemalten Bilder sind sehr liebevoll gestaltet und werden aufgrund der Animationen, Interaktionen  und insbesondere der Sounds definitiv nicht so schnell langweilig. Das Spiel beinhaltet nach Angaben der Entwickler weit über 1000 unterschiedliche mundgemachte Sounds. Und ich muss sagen, ich habe nicht nur einmal herzhaft gelacht, wenn ich mal wieder einen neuen Sound entdeckt hatte.

Eine Leiste am unteren Bildrand zeigt die zu suchenden Objekte. Um das stumpfe Suchen dieser Objekte etwas mit geistiger Arbeit zu füllen, könnt ihr die Zielobjekte auch anklicken und erhaltet dann einen kleinen Hinweis, wo sie zu finden sind. Zum Beispiel: "Schildkröte Raphael trocknet in der Sonne." Versteht ihr den Hinweis, werdet ihr schneller fündig - oder auch nicht.

Das Spiel bietet auf jeden Fall Suchtpotenzial für Groß und Klein.


Edit: Ich muss ja sagen, ein ganz klein wenig beneide ich die Entwickler schon um den Spaß, den sie ganz offensichtlich im Tonstudio (oder wo auch immer) hatten.

32925331.review:
非常好玩非常让人开心的一个休闲游戏！

玩法就是找东西，不过算是找东西游戏里非常有意思的了，一开始还是不要瞎点，看一遍提示再慢慢找会很好玩。如果电脑屏幕大一点玩得会更爽，我小笔记本玩起来就有点憋屈。有几个提示真的很难找，尤其是最后一个工厂地图非常非常大自己找的话会找瞎眼的。不过大多数提示和答案都很巧妙，还能给人带来解谜的乐趣。而且内容非常欢乐，就算是死亡内容也带着一股轻松感，大概是整体的画风造成的吧w

一开始就被音效可爱到，明显音效都是人声配的，动物的声音啊汽车引擎声啊都特别可爱。突然就有种你的叔叔哥哥各种亲友在你旁边轮流发出好玩的声音哄你玩似的。比如农场的那个鹈鹕还是啥的，特别好玩。细节都很到位，非常丰富，让人会像小孩一样很兴奋地到处探索。

最后的stuff表也非常欢乐，和游戏是一样的形式，许多小人散落在一张大地图上，点击小人可以显示名字和职位，当然还有有趣的音效了，很有创意，谢谢你们做了这么可爱的游戏。

32840210.review:
A highly underwhelming experience. And to be honest: Pretty obnoxious as well.

The idea of "Hidden Folks" is simply awesome. An interactive version of "where is waldo" (or any other search stuff game), where you have to move stuff around and have to interacte with things to actually find something. Yes sounds good on paper.

However, it is bad executed. On some maps you can interact with maybe like 30 (!) % you see on screen. F.e. on the big camping map. There are so many objects you can not interact with, that it leaves you incredible disatisfied.
And even when you can interact with it: 90 % of the time "interaction" will be a simple click. Only in one jungle level, and later from the city-levels on, you may have to hold and slide with the mouse in order to open up a garage-door, pull a lever or move a satellite. So the game is more like a click-frenzy then an acutal interactive searchgame.
Also there are actually so few assets, that the game gets highly repetitive in short. The negative highlight was the "desert map", that is actually way to big and filled with the same bland looking spots. Don't try to defend this by saying "it is a search game, everything has to look the same". That is just cheap.

However what made me refund the game was the atrocious, incredibly obnoxious sound design. I can not understand by any means, how anyone can find the soundscape in this game "funny", or "sweet". Just imagine a bunch of mid-30s, maybe 40s, trying to sound cute to impress some girls making "sweet" sounds with their mouth. Sounds creepy right? Yes it is. When I first heard the "MEEP MEEEP" sound of the cars I wanted to smash my fucking head against the table.


It does maybe cost less then 8 € (regulary), however I can not recommend it. The "interaction" is a freaking joke, everything is highly repetitive, and the atrocious soundscape of this game is simply the worst I have ever listened to in a video game.

32839800.review:
This is an old-school "hidden object" game, by which I mean that it's more like "Where's Waldo?" than the modern crop of HO+ Adventures. You have a bunch of scenes, of increasing size and complexity, and within them you have to find specific people and objects, and that's it. 

The scenes are somewhat interactive -- you can touch things to move them, flip switches, turn dials, etc. And the things that you're looking for are accompanied by mild clues. You can also zoom in and out, although frustratingly, for the larger puzzles, you can't zoom all the way out.

Lastly, it's hand-drawn with cute made-by-people-beatboxing-into-a-microphone-style sound effects.

The complaints I have about the game are relatively minor. Some of the achievements seem to be at least mildly broken. A significant number of people never receive the "All Factory Objects Found," even if they have indeed found all the factory objects, and thus they also never receive the "All Objects Found," achievement. If you're an achievement completionist, this is frustrating.

On many computers with smaller screens, the game doesn't seem to work. This might be specific to Linux, or it might just be a resolution thing. On my iMac, I was able to play the game just fine, but on my Linux-based laptop, the game wouldn't run properly in fullscreen, and when running in a window, the resolution was too low to be feasably playable.

Also, there's no way for more than one person to play the game. This is the sort of game that you'll want to show your friends, but in order for them to try it (and track their progress), you'd need to reset your own game.

Despite all of that, it's a super fun, charming game which provides maybe 4-6 hours of decent play for about as many dollars (depending on whether you pick it up on sale or not). I thought it was well worth it.

32825158.review:
[b]Um jogo de exploração do cenário muito desafiador nos moldes dos livros de "Onde está o Wally?´", mas com a ótima adição de interação com o ambiente na busca dos objetivos.[/b]

[h1]Interação com o ambiente[/h1]
O grande diferencial que Hidden Folks tem sobre os ótimos livros de "Onde está o Wally?´" é interação com o cenário. Abrir janelas, garagens, gavetas, ligar televisões, sacudir árvores, são algumas das ações que o jogo exige que você faça a fim de conseguir o maior número possível de objetos no nível. De acordo com o avanço no jogo, as interações se tornam cada vez mais complexas, requerendo do jogador uma grande atenção e concentração para não se perder no cenário. 

[h1]O rico cenário[/h1]
Não apenas nas interações com o ambiente que existem animações no cenário, ele possui vida por si só. Animais, pessoas se movimentando, carros, pássaros; a quantidade de movimentos que acontecem ao mesmo tempo nestes mapas que vão aumentando cada vez mais, o que enriquece muito a experiência. Em certos momentos, chega a fazer o jogador se perder várias vezes. Além das animações, o jogo conta com diversos efeitos sonoros que são ativados quando o jogador interage com diferentes partes do cenário, deixando a experiência muito mais divertida. 
Ao longo do jogo, os cenários vão constantemente evoluindo de uma paisagem florestal, se tornando mais ruralizada, até caminhar para uma sociedade totalmente industrializada e urbana, tornando os mapas incrivelmente largos e com uma variedade imensa de formas de se encontrar os objetivos.

[h1]Vale a compra?[/h1]
Hidden Folks não é um jogo para quem não tem paciência. Se você quer apenas encontrar o número mínimo de itens em cada mapa apenas para avançar mais rapidamente, certamente irá achar o jogo fraco e até curto. Mas se você gosta da proposta e gostaria de se investir para encontrar o máximo de objetivos em cada cenário, o jogo é um prato cheio. Muito desafiador e bem divertido; uma bela forma de se passar o tempo. 

Veredito:
Nota -
[h1]7,4[/h1]

A very beautiful but simple game to pass the time. The art style and ambiant noices are very charming. The gameplay is basic, but quirky, making it hard for me to hate it even when I have trouble finding the last person/object. There's no fluff and the game is pretty much what you see when you buy it, but totally worth the money. It's the equivalnt of buying a "Where's Waldo" book except on the computer and more interactive. 

That all being said, I was able to finish the game in 4-5 hours (finding all the objects up to the factory update), but the progression the game puts you through difinetly gets harder over time. If you're up for a bit of a challenge, this game might stump you a few times, but it shouldn't leave you wanting to punch your computer screen.

“爱过，不约，救我妈，保大，多喝热水，会瞎”
                                                                ——写在前面的话

就买这游戏之前
我和来自steam的机智帅气的高冷同学进行了对话
当时觉得20+买一个Where's Wally?的黑白版有点亏
高冷君是这么回答我的
"我感觉20+的价格  对于作者辛辛苦苦手绘的这些图，这些小人和他们各自的生活 来说  很[strike]指[/strike]值了"
入手后真开始玩
就理解了
这不是单是一个游戏
这是一个世界
用比喻来说的话
大概是涂鸦版的清明上河图吧

一定要确认自己是耐心,耐心,再耐心的人
然后再考虑买这个游戏
单纯的当成找人、找东西来玩的话
有点白瞎了

游戏的最大乐趣就是看着[strike]吐槽[/strike]描述来找每一个东西
没找到可能还不觉得
找到的时候往往会感受到作者的巧思
各种各样的东西都能互动也是乐趣之一
很多地方就超可爱
比如挪开井盖就会弹出来掉进去的东西
拉开窗帘看屋里的人都在做什么

好几张地图都画的很大(画图这功夫就值这个价格了)
包罗万象啊
有人在树上
有人在车下
有人倒在荒漠
有人坐在水中
玩到后面都有点感动
大概真的是每一个创作者心中都有一个世界
但这个作者尤为可爱hhhhh

还有个人很喜欢的一点
游戏的音效非常萌

32775906.review:
Ein typisches Wimmelbild Spiel, wer solche Spiele gerne mag, wird bei diesem Spiel keinen Fehlkauf machen.

Es gibt einige Gebiete in diesem Spiel, manche recht klein, andere sehr groß, wo man verschiedene Personen und Gegenstände finden muss. Alle Suchziele haben eine kleine Beschreibung, anhand dessen man ein wenig erraten kann, wo diese Person / dieser Gegenstand zu finden ist, allerdings sind diese Tipps oft ein klein wenig ungenau oder ein Rätsel. Manche Tipps helfen einem kaum, weil aus dem Tipp hervorgeht, dass sie auf dem gesamten Bild sein können. Für manche Suchobjekte muss man erst Veränderungen am Bild vornehmen, um diese zu finden, manchmal muss man zB nur einen Vorhang öffnen, aber manchmal muss man auch aufwendigere Dinge machen, wie zB einem Objekt auf einem Fließband mit mehreren Dingen helfen den Weg übers Fließband zu nehmen um am Ziel schließlich das gesuchte Objekt zu offenbaren.

Der komplette Sound des Spiels wurde von Menschen mit ihrer Stimme produziert, was recht lustig anzuhören ist. Wassergeräusch, Autohupen etc.

Ich selbst habe an manchen Bildern relativ lange gesessen, weil manche Zielobjekte sehr schwer zu finden waren und die Tipps manchmal nicht viel geholfen haben. Ich habe das Spiel schließlich in etwas über 3 Stunden inklusive aller Achievments durchgespielt, also Spielzeittechnisch ist nicht so viel zu erwarten, aber ich weiß natürlich nicht, wie schnell ich im Vergleich zum Durchschnitt war. Kleine negative Kritik an dieser Stelle: Ich habe das Spiel durchgespielt gehabt, bevor ich die letzte Steam Sammelkarte bekommen habe, also werd ich das Spiel nochmal laufen lassen müssen, wenn ich diese noch bekommen möchte...

Die Entwickler arbeiten wohl derzeit auch noch an weiteren Gebieten für das Spiel, das derzeit letzte Gebiet "Fabrik" mit mehreren Suchbildern wurde wohl auch erst später gratis hinzugefügt, also kann es sein, dass die weiteren Gebiete die evtl. noch kommen, ebenfalls gratis sein werden.

Fazit: Für alle geduldigen Wimmelbild Fans wärmstens zu empfehlen. Für Neueinsteiger in diese Spielkategorie könnte es ein wenig frustrierend sein, da würde ich für den Start eher leichtere Spiele empfehlen, wie zB Hero of the Kingdom.

32774986.review:
I love this charming little game! It's like Where's Waldo, but full of interactable objects that are made even better with original sound effects, the puzzles aren't that impossible for the game to seem a chore but rather it's a fun challenge to scroll through the map trying to find the characters. The size of the map was a little daunting after the tiny lil puzzles, but it made it more fun, clicking on everything just to see if it's interactable. 

I highly recommend it for hidden object puzzle fans, or people looking for a non-intensive game to pass the time, well worth the price and I hope more maps get released soon :)

[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review 

PLEASE NOTE (2017): Due to recent false accusations of plagarism, I (the reviewer) would like to stress that all these reviews and upcoming reviews are original and are not blatantly copied. Other reviews are used to help stress my point across but are changed in such a way to make the review in my own wording [/h1]

Hidden Folks is a hidden object game developed by Adriaan de Jongh and Sylvain Tegroeg

This is one of the very few games that I actually enjoyed playing. Finding hidden items in such a big open space is fun, challenging yet oddly satisfying. The game is fun to play in short bursts and I like that you can play it on your own or in turns with friends

The game takes a more sacrastic tone with soem funny sound effects and music that makes it original and funny to play. The only complaint I have is the default colour scheme the games takes, it can get slightly confusing when everything is white and the only thing that is black is the outline

But overall, Hidden Folks is a funny little game to play in short bursts!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

32754667.review: There's nothing more to say that Hidden Folks gets a 10! Relaxing and fun, it's like Where's Waldo with Monty Python-like sound effects. Match up the charcters/items on the bar below with it's twin in the drawing. Fortunately you can use your mouse wheel to zoom in. Be sure and read the description of what you're looking for, as it will give a hint where the character or item is. You will also need to move some things as you go along to reveal hidden items. The areas start out small, but get larger/more complicated as you go up the levels. It saves when you exit, although when you go back in, some of the things you did (example: cutting down plants) will be undone, but you won't lose anything you've found. Click (some things you can drag) and experiment to see what you can do and find.

32752787.review: This game is absolutely charming and delightful. The play is simple enough: find the some or all of the little folks, critters, and/or objects on a list to progress to the next scene. It's a low-stress exploration through intricate doodles. The sounds are not only funny, if you zoom in you'll often find them helpful when searching. For example, if the hint given involves pigs, zoom in as you move around and you'll hear the faint snorting to help you locate the pigm that help you locate the target. Not only is it fun to find the targets you need to progress, you're likely to keep poking around just to see what happens and hear all the sound effects. While it might seem like a kids game, this game is for anyone who enjoys whimsy.

32722271.review:
[spoiler]         每次评测发不出去就很僵硬·····GG这么长要重新再写一次[/spoiler]
        刚看到这游戏，第一个让我想起来的是国内之前比较火的一个手机游戏叫“找NI妹”，不禁回想起几年之前在学生会送老的饭席上跟另一个喝高了的女生一起找了个没人的角落开始玩那个游戏。咳咳···扯远了····于是我就趁着夏促买了。
        一开始的游戏体验十分棒，简笔线条的画面足够宏大，配合创意巧妙的隐藏手法、精致的关卡设计、走心的细节，这些加在一起，已经可以称得上是一款不错的游戏了，但这还不够，最惊喜的部分应该是游戏里的人声配音，有创意有品位，还多了那么一点点小逼格。而全部操作甚至只有简单的点点点和间或拖动一下。物超所值。
        就在我以为自己渐入佳境，可以趁这个周末把游戏通关的时候，我来到了旱地的最后一关……
        [spoiler] The Beginning of Nightmare……[/spoiler]
        画面太大、太空、太白了，玩到最后有一种罹患雪盲症的错觉。讲真，我不怕你元素多，但这样白茫茫一片，真的玩起来挺难受的。写评测前的两个小时，一半时间是花在这个图上的。
        实际上，足够通关数量的要素并不难找，难点只在于重度强迫症患者[spoiler]很显然就是我[/spoiler]想要全收集达成成就，这就很难了。虽然从某种意义上这也使得游戏变得十分耐玩……所以虽然是个比较难啃成就的硬骨头，但我在这里还是要给出好评。
