32644360.review:
Adorable little gem of a game.

Bying this game to me feels like literally being able to buy yourself some time of pure joy and relaxation, you know, being able to go carefree and forget about where you are at the moment. The cutesy hand-drawn animation makes you want to inspect every corner of the map in order to see what the tiny peeps are up to. The worlds are diverse and the maps very detailed (although to me a bit repetitive, see next paragraph). I love it how the descriptions/hints are very constructive and almost always point you in the right direction, so the game rarely gets frustrating. 

And, just as every other overly spoilt member of the gaming community, I'll want to point out some things I found annoying and wish were different. I think the interactions, objects and sounds get repetitive at some point. After a while, you just lose the desire to explore because it becomes too predictable. I wish there were more easter eggs and unique areas/animations and that the objects and sounds wouldn't get reused so much. Towards the final stages I was just looking to find the items and complete the chapters as fast as possible because nothing would intrigue me too much. But, I get it, this is probably a small team with limited resources, I am aware of the fact that I am expecting too much. I'm just saying it would be nice. Another thing is, all the people jumping and waving as if they want to get your attention is distracting and doesn't make much sense. It would be better if they would just do whatever it is that they're doing in their tiny little universe.

I'd love to see this game evolve, possibly have sequels with color, music, etc. I hope this type of game catches on, I think we need more of this.

32616214.review:
曾经有一段时间迷上这类找东西的游戏书，这个游戏与书相比最大的进步就是：场景可以是动态的、可互动的，这就使可玩性加倍增长。这个游戏场景是手绘的，音效全都都是人配的（非常魔性），场景内元素丰富、细节十足，对于目标的介绍也很有趣，有时玩梗，有时双关（英语）。我认为这个游戏不仅是有趣的，而且对于一个独立的开发组来说，这样巨大的工作量也是值得佩服的。
然而我要给中文翻译一个差评......有些翻译完全没有顾及到原句的意思，重要的信息也没有表现出来，有些用词也和日常使用有差异（例如fortune翻译为“运程”，虽然也没什么错，但乍一看还真一时反应不过来），所以我建议有基础的朋友尽量用英文游戏。
更新：6小时全成就（目前），感觉眼睛已经花掉了233，新关卡无论从体量还是从设计上来说都是无可挑剔的，期待接下来的更新。

32615889.review:
Not for everyone.

The game is wonderfully made with beautiful detailed drawings, funny sound effects, a variety of game play. I thought I would enjoy it since I do like point and click games, but it made me extremely anxious and stressed out after the first 3 levels. It takes a lot more patience to complete than I have. You do need to click around randomly all over the place to uncover things, and because of the amount of guesswork required, each click doesn't feel rewarding but stressful to me. There are no hints except for a vague sentence.

I'd recommend trying it out, but don't expect much from it.
32615889.developer_response:
Hey Nelesia,

Sorry to hear the game didn't click for you! What do you think I could change about the game to make it less anxious or stressing to you? 

About the clues: they are mildly vague on purpose, as otherwise it wouldn't be a clue for a straight-up give-away, and that wouldn't be fun at all. May I recommend focussing on the hints some more and avoid clicking around randomly? 

Give that a try and see whether you like the game more that way! If there's anything else I can do, please do let me know!

매 테마마다 3~4개 씩의 스테이지가 존재합니다.
처음에는 몸풀기로 쉬운 문제를 주지만, 본편이 시작되면 지옥도가 펼쳐집니다.

이 게임은 월리를 찾아서 처럼 단순히 숨은 그림을 찾는 방식이 아닙니다.

이 게임에서 무언가를 찾는 방식을 비유하자면

1. '철수'를 찾아라 
2. 철수는 하얀 모자를 쓰고 검은 옷을 입고 있다.
3. 철수는 사람들이 많이 모이고 음악이 흐르는 곳에서 춤을 추고 싶어한다.
4. 철수는 현재 '금요일 밤 홍대입구역 7번 출구 반경 200m 내에 서있다.

ㄹㅇ 눈알 빠집니다. 사물은 가만히 있긴 한데, 무려 사람은 다 움직여서 정신없는 것은 덤입니다.
추측을 하든, 무한 클릭을 하든 말 그대로 '숨어있는' 사물을 찾아내는 것은 여간 쉬운 일이 아닙니다.
하나가 안찾아져서 20분 동안 그것만 바라보고 있는 경우가 허다합니다.

그래도 돈값은 하는 것 같네요. 분위기도 괜찮고 흥미로운 게임이었습니다. 
어서 완결을 내고 지우든가 해야겠습니다....

32564097.review:
Absolutely amazing. The art is crisp and the sound effects are hilarious. You can't not fall in love with this game if you ever loved "Where's Wally?" books. The themed levels make them delightful to look at.

The game plays well. There is a variety of puzzle sizes yet something to find in almost all of the space. Levels are designed well except for perhaps the big city level, which felt a bit too empty near the top. You can move, open, push and pull various objects. These are typically introduced via a small tutorial level. A short clue is provided for every search target, which turns every hunt into a mini-game by itself. Targets usually have strong visual clues, too, and ambient sound effects may also help. I rarely found myself completely stuck.

Cons are few. Occasionally, there are minor visual glitches - people appearing behind lakes or buildings instead of in front of them, that sort of thing. These don't affect gameplay at all. The only other con is that there are few levels, and 5-6 of them are very small and simplistic. On that note...

I LOVE the (free) factory levels update, and I'd happily pay for more levels in this charming game.

32558101.review:
I'm usually not into point'n'click hidden object games but this one is just... good.
It's fun to sit down with for a couple 10 or 20 minutes to mess about in while enjoying the oddly satisfying mouth-made sound effects.

It's like [i]Where's Waldo?[/i] but at the same time it's not like [i]Where's Waldo?[/i] at all, it has it's own unique touch which completely differs it from most, [i]if not all[/i] other hidden object games.

You do more than just clicking on 1 thing after scanning the area with your eyes.
Stuff is hidden behind bushes, in pot holes, behind doors and other stuff. You need to twist and turn objects to reveal stuff etc.

One thing that I can't be more appreciative of is 1 of the in-game settings it has. A brightness slider.
If you're like me you hate constant bright, white colours screaming at your eyes for 20 minutes straight.
This game allows you to turn down the brightness, and it allows you to completely change the colour-scheme between a white background, black background, and 1 more filter that I'm not entirely sure what is but it looked like it was a blue-light filter.

The art looks great, there's some funny references/easter eggs.
There's no stupid timers, you're free to take all the time you want, whether it's spent actually trying to complete the levels or continuously clicking on things to listen to the sound effects.

Fluff. Cute. Fun.
It's a Waldo-like game with amazing mouth-made sound effects, what more do you want from a hidden object clicker!?

32546366.review:
Made me feel like a child again. Think of an interactive Where's Waldo where you can click on just about any object and get some sort of reaction/sound effect.

 It's not just simply clicking on hidden characters and items. Each character/item has a clue within it's description that certainly makes the fun of finding what you are looking for. You put the clue together and look for the location that sounds to match what the clue is describing. A lot of times it's not just simply clicking on a character that blends in with the rest of the environment. Sometimes you have to actually interact with the environment and trigger a response that will make the character/item show up so that you can find it. This is when things get more tricky than simply scanning around for the character/item. This is also what makes this a more advanced version if you will of Where's Waldo. In addition you aren't just looking for 1 guy hiding in a gigantic map but rather an assortment. I'd say it probably gets close to around 20 for the larger maps.

  Overall a great time passer. It kept me hooked that I just kept wanting to get through each map with no stopping. Didn't realize the hours had flown by. Certainly worth it and to support the developer. Especially if they will add additonal maps in the future. 

  Great job overall. Sound effects are awesome, the maps have a nice art to them and the maps are very smooth scrolling despite so much activity going on within the larger maps.  Easily recommended.

32545850.review:
A great game!

I had my eye on this one for a while and had to get it, once it finally got on sale at -25%. A splendid deal for such an entertaining and (mostly) relaxing game. 

As of right now, after a playtime of about 6 hours (and 1.5 hours having the game iddling in the background) I've found all the hidden folks and objects and had a blast doing so.

In case you're wondering why it was only mostly relaxing: It was also really, really, really frustrating at the end, when I was looking for those tiny missing things to complete (perfect) the game. Once I was really tempted to look at a guide after searching for one particular ball for over an hour, but coming back the next day with fresh eyes really did help and I solved the mystery of the locked up ball in less then 2 minutes.

As I've read in the forum, the developers are still adding new levels/areas, so I hope this keeps up for a while.


[b]Point by point:[/b]

+ There's no click counter.
+ There's no punishment, score deduction for simply looking/clicking around.
+ There's no score.
+ There's no leaderboard.
+ The sounds are relaxing and hilarious.
+ The descriptions on the folks and objects you have to look for are brilliant, there are puns, jokes and brilliantly hidden hints.
- Only about 6-7 hours of contents as of now, since many other games at this price point offer longer entertainment it feels fair listing it as a negative
+ It's very innovative for a seek and find game, i.e. not all levels follow the same logic

[b]tldr;[/b] a definitve recommendation for 6 € (that's the sale price at -25%), a maybe at 8€ (maybe if there is another level adding another hour or two... how about space?)

32525545.review:
I absolutely love the game. From the art style to the hints given to even the sound effects!

Originally, I was a bit hesitant as I don't usually play slower, more relaxed games but I decided to give this game a shot after hearing so many good things about it from some friends.

The first thing I noticed was the art style. It's got a really cute vibe to it that helps the game feel very casual and helped 'draw' me into the game. It's also good as it makes each character and item that the player is looking for unique and relatively unmistakeable.

The second thing was the soundd effects. Solid 10/10. Amazing choice. All of the sound effects in the game is literally a guy just making the noises with his mouth. For a bird, he just says "tweet tweet". I love it and I've just had a good time listening to the sounds.

Another thing that I enjoyed were the creative hints. In one of the earlier, forest levels, one of the hints given had something to do with Isaac Newton, and the character I was looking for? Hidden beneath an apple tree. It's brilliant, the clues are designed very well, giving adequate hints without making the game too easy.

One more thing I liked were the small 'minigames' between the big searchig  maps. There was a small 'escort mission' where you would simply help a villager across a map by moving obsticles in their way. There are also small searching maps that introduce you to new mechanics that you didn't know existed, that helped players in later stages of the game.

Finally, I likes the options and game settings. One of the things that I was hugely impressed by is the colour toggle. As someone with weak eyes that can't stare at a screen for too long, the toggle allowed the game's colours to turn from black and white to a less eye-straining beige. Although it's reatively minor, I appreciate that aspect and it improved my game experience overall.


*Thing I wasn't too keen on*
This honestly isn't much, defenitely too small to prevent anyone from buying the game, but I just feel that in some of the bigger maps, it would be nice to be able to scroll out completely so I can see the map in it's entirety. Other than that, it's an amazing game


TL;DR  All in all, I love the game. It's very chill with the art style, hints, funny sound effects and interesting game modes. I would reccomend people to get it as it's a good game to relax with after a long day or if you only have a few minutes to play.

32524714.review: Hidden Folks is a delightful experience all around. With amazing hand drawn visuals, incredibly endearing vocally produced sound effects and just the right amount of levels I cannot recommend this title enough!

32523932.review:
[u]Résumé[/u] :

Un jeu où il vous faudra trouver des objets/personnages dans des maps immenses, animées de partout, des bruitages dans tous les sens, et une direction artistique globalement extra.

[u]Les +[/u] :

- un vrai challenge, super bien équilibré (sauf pour un objet qui est très mal décrit, sur tous les forums il est identifié comme étant hyper difficile à trouver (indice : 3.10.3) ).
- une ambiance sonore déroutante mais finalement top, qui vous aidera dans vos quêtes. Jouez avec le son coupé, vous verrez, vous passerez du difficile à l'impossible immédiatement ^^
- un prix raisonnable pour un petit chef-d'oeuvre comme celui-ci !

[u]Les moins[/u] :

- vraiment usant pour les yeux. Vraiment vraiment. Pensez à faire des petites pauses, sinon vous allez pleurer devant votre écran.
- comme dit + haut, un objet foireux, perso j'sais pas comment on peut le trouver sans la solution :(

[b]conclusion :[/b]

Une perle, un coup de coeur gros comme ça ! Comptez 3-4h de jeu max, mais super satisfaisantes pour les personnes patientes ! Les animations sont marrantes, il y en a partout ! À ne pas louper pour les personnes qui aiment les puzzles et les jeux de recherche en général. 

Par contre attention, si vous bloquez sur le 'où est Charlie' de votre petit frère, passez votre chemin. Là c'est du hardcore.

32517709.review:
No click counters. 
No timers. 
No unnecessary game modes. 

Just you and the challenge to find all Folks and Objects following their respective clues.
This is one of the purest gaming experiences I've had in a long time. Expect up to six hours of play time (if you're really slow like me) with the Factory Update. Don't forget that the developers are still working on free additional maps.

In the now immortal words of Nina Struthers, "I bet you want this game. I bet you wanna buy this game. You will buy this game. I believe in you. Buy this motherfucking game!"

32501881.review:
Hidden Folks ist ein unterhaltsames und interaktives Wimmelbildspiel.

Es ist zwar nur in schwarz-weiß gehalten, aber alles wurde von Hand und mit viel Liebe gezeichnet und es ist sehr viel in Bewegung.

Hintergrundmusik gibt es auch keine, aber wenn man versucht eine gesuchte Person zu "erhören", würde diese auch nur stören, mal abgesehen davon dass es auch die Atmosphäre des Spiels ein wenig kaputt machen würde.
Dafür ist die Vertonung der Soundeffekte sehr lustig und gelungen.

Die Schwieigkeitskurve finde ich auch sehr gut gewählt.
Wenn man ein neues Gebiet startet hat man erstmal einen kleinen Level zum eingewöhnen, wie und mit was man alles agieren kann, um dann auf der folgenden großen Map nicht komplett ins "kalte Wasser geschupst" zu werden.

Alles in allem, sorgt es für ein paar unterhaltsame Stunden (und vielleicht auch ein paar frustierende Momente, wenn man alles finden will und teilwiese eine Stunde lang ohne Erfolg sucht) und erfreulicherweise sollen noch weitere Level folgen.
Für mich ist dieses Spiel eine klare Empfehlung (es sei denn, man mag absolut keine Wimmelbilder).

It is a hidden object game in the  "Wimmelbilder" or "Where's Waldo" style.
I play it from time to time, as a relaxing experience.
You'll notice the love of the developers for their game in every screen and in every single detail  - and it has lots of them. 
It's hard to describe but somehow you just get the feeling that the devs really, really  like their own game. It somehow creates a rather nice atmosphere. And It's full of -often very silly- little jokes,
The support is great, the devs just released an update, adding a complete new area to discover for free.

If you like these kinda games, then definitely get it! Im pretty certain it is the best in it's category you can get,

32465454.review: I started playing Hidden Folks since early February this year (2017). The game itself is VERY, VERY calming (although sometimes I did feel anxious when I cannot find certain character, and I just zoomed out and started randomly click everywhere lol). Yet nothing can compare the huge satisfaction every time I found something. I enjoyed Where's Wally and Hidden Folks is like a motion vertion of it, only better. I've never been so obsessed with any game that require you to "find something", but the simple drawing style (“Wimmelbilderbuch”?) and the dubbing is just sooooooooo cute!! I'm also very happy that I might be one of the first that have again, found everything after its latest and last update. Very brain challenging. Highly recommended!

32455124.review:
A fun little confection that is over a little too soon.  The art and sounds are wonderfully goofy, and the clues are well written and necessary for finding everything.  

The game is very unique.  Some might compare it to those hidden object games that plague tablets, but is actually very different.  Rather than just clicking on everything, you often have to use the clues to manipulate the environment to coax out your targets.  

I hope they're be more.  The update that just came out was great (the garden fork was fiendishly difficult!); but I'm finished now and am wondering how I'll be able to go on...

32348384.review:
Hidden Folks è una breve esperienza unica e geniale che consiglio a tutti.
Lo scopo del gioco è trovare determinati oggetti in dettagliatissime mappe disegnate a mano, senza limiti di tempo e utilizzando indizi divertenti e mai banali, che vi spingeranno addirittura a comporre piccole storie autonome al fine di capire perché un oggetto è nascosto in un certo posto.
Tutte le scelte stilistiche di Hidden Folks sono uniche: osservando e toccando ogni entità all'interno delle immense mappe noteremo che i suoni emessi sono imitati da una persona, un dettaglio che strapperebbe un sorriso a chiunque.
Il gameplay è ben pensato e mai scorretto, sugli oltre 100+ oggetti da trovare, saranno al massimo 5 che potrebbero far pensare che l'indizio non era abbastanza chiaro o non intuitivo.
Una nota di merito anche alla traduzione italiana, che ha saputo mantenere o addirittura inventare giochi di parole sugli indizi.
In generale, il gioco è un'esperienza molto rilassante che vi farà ragionare e apprezzare un vero videogioco senza compromessi, assolutamente consigliato!

32307549.review:
[h1]Найди кота! И ящерку. И очки, мать их.[/h1]

Привет всем любителям ребусов!

Казуальная 2D инди-игра открывает нам рисованный мир, предлагая с головой уйти в поиски предметов. Черно-белая прорисовка уровней и забавная (чисто голосовая) озвучка делают игру весьма стильной, но, увы, уникальным этот стиль я назвать не могу.

Все это уже было в короткометражных забавных мультиках от "Хрустим". Так что идея голосовой озвучки явно не новаторская. Но я бы не сказала, что это минус игры. Даже при этом Hidden Folks - это отличный способ сломать мозг себе и детям... Да, детям эту игру смело можно ставить - все три часа игры прошли довольно безобидно, если исключить потраченные нервные клетки. А в тех же мультиках "Хрустима", тем временем, были и туалетные темы, и преобладающие сцены насилия. Так что Hidden Folks не имеет возрастных ограничений, как по мне. Главное - делать перерывы, иначе можно окосеть :)

И еще - проверено - игра отлично подойдет для компании. Так глаза будут портиться у всех, но зато не так стремительно) 

Приятной игры и удачного поиска!

31966082.review:
Hidden Folks is one of the very few hidden object games I like. It’s not like the others that have a weird story or extremely nonsensical item layouts. It’s Where’s Waldo with a strange sense of charm due to all the mouth-based sound effects and abundant animations.

I’ll start off by saying the game has very few problems. I found the default color scheme much too hard on my eyes with the generous amount of white, but the developer included a sepia filter and an inverse color scheme if you wanted to see tons of black. Sepia was perfect for me, so I’m glad it’s there. The only other issue was the number of interactive objects on the big city map. I did not enjoy clicking and dragging open a bunch of blinds, only to have them close again shortly after. I tended to forget what was in there and I would have preferred they just stay open so I didn’t have to open them repeatedly.

Most of the little people and creatures have animations and sounds that play when you click on them. They also produce an ambient murmuring type of deal depending on the map and how zoomed in you are. It feels lively with all the movement and I appreciated the number of silly mouth sounds. I highly recommend clicking on things multiple times to hear all the voicework. You’ll not find a soundtrack, so having a podcast readily available wouldn’t be a bad idea.

The gameplay is what you’re probably thinking. You’ll have objects and people at the bottom of the screen that you must find. They all come with little hints which helps greatly for some of the very large maps. You’ll have small maps and large ones which will require zooming in and out and some screen movement. It all works without any bugs during my experience.

There are more levels incoming from what I saw in the game, but what’s there provides a pretty good time. It’s a wonderfully pure searching experience that I hope to have more of soon. I also wouldn’t mind a sequel that introduces some maps with colors.

Cada coisa que é necessária achar contém uma dica, a qual não deixa muito fácil de achar o objeto/pessoa mas dá uma noção de onde pode estar. Os mapas (se é que pode chamar assim) são enormes, há um número gigantesco de coisas que são clicáveis, você pode passar 5 minutos ou 1 hora para passar cada fase. Muito divertido. Meu pontos negativos foi o preço, que custa bastante para um jogo desses.... Também foi as poucos conquistas que devesse obter ao longo do tempo, não foram muitas para um jogo tão enorme como esse. 31423045.review:
Een geanimeerde Where’s Wally, dat is de beste omschrijving van de app Hidden Folks. In de boeken moet Wally gevonden worden op een plaat boordevol grappige gebeurtenissen. In de game Hidden Folks zoekt de speler een mannetje of een voorwerp. De tekeningen komen tot leven via de kleine bewegingen en geluidjes van de vele personen. Per opdracht is er een hint. Zoals: ‘Deze rottende vis verdrijft potentiële klanten.’ Zo wordt deels onthuld dat de rottende vis zich zal bevinden in de buurt van een marktkraam. De vis kan ook verstopt zitten, wat zorgt dat zoeken alleen niet genoeg is. Al klikkend gebeurt er soms wat met het struikgewas, een tent of hooibaal.

De app is een uniek kunstwerkje van Adriaan de Jongh en tekenaar Sylvain ­Tegroeg. In een geheel eigen zwart-witstijl presenteren ze de puzzelopdrachten. Het slissen, puffen, kwaken en de andere ruim 900 geluiden zijn knap gemaakt, vooral als je weet dat alle geluiden door een mensen gemaakt zijn. Voor de fans van het zoek-en-vind-genre een heerlijke game. Mede door de grootte van de tekeningen lijkt het soms onmogelijk. Gelukkig mag de speler vaak na vijf van de vijftien voorwerpen al door naar de volgende plaat. Puzzelgamers die wel alles willen vinden, hebben een behoorlijke kluif aan Hidden Folks.

31388328.review:
This game is charming for many reasons, and is exactly what I was hoping for when first viewing the trailer!

First of all, it gives you the warm memories of sitting in the library staring intently at that 'Waldo' cover. Even so, this game shines with its own unique experience, not just latching on to past treasures. 

Its difficulty ranges from item to item, allowing for various challenges and creative thinking. To help hint to specific locations or events, each item has a small description or summery that leads you along. Also the oral sound effects are not only charming, but helpful for when you are near a certain object or person! I've also really grown to enjoy the art and animation style as well. 

A great game to relax and play, really brings you into a fun filled game of hide and seek.

31289037.review:
After a long & hard day of massagin’ horses, I like to lie in the back of my truck and play me some Hidden Folks. 

Now, don’t get me wrong; I love my job. There’s just nothin’ as fulfillin’ or as interestin’ as relaxin’ them horses. 

But it does get real stressful. Especially at the beginnings of the massages, when the horses don’t know what you’re doin’. Because they don’t know you. You have to show 'em long-faced creatures that you're trustworthy, first, before the touchin’ can begin. “You have to assuage it before you massage it,” as the sayin’ goes. And not every horse can be assuaged. That fact alone is stressful (as no-assuagin’ means no massagin’ can get done, which means no pay. Money ‘n’ time lost).

Yeah, it’s on No-Pay days that I really need things like Hidden Folks.

But let’s assume you’ve assuaged the horse. Well, there’s still potential to get stressed out. 

Not all horses take kindly to deep pressure massage on their big, ripplin’ muscles. And ya can’t help but think about how the horse might kick ya, or bite your groinular region. Deep tissue massage is essential to eliminate the knots in their muscles, but ya can’t help but think about the danger. 

[Sometimes I take a break with Hidden Folks - plus a smoke - after the deep tissue massage on the large muscles. But usually my schedule’s so packed that there’s no time for breaks]

And suckin’ them horses’ penises can get stressful, ‘cause it’s an essential part of the massage (with them male horses) and you don’t know how much semen them’s got. And when one of ‘em ejaculates too much, sometimes you gag, and it causes ya to vomit. So ya gotta watch your suckin’, and switch to lickin’ the sides of them horses’ penises right before them’s ready to ejaculate, a stressful act every time that Hidden Folks helps me relax from.

Worst of all, though, there’s the owners of the horses. You’d think people read the contracts they sign. Almost all the time, though, they start yellin’ an’ complainin’ when they see me massagin’ their lady horses’ hoo-hahs with my penis. Sometimes—and I ain’t makin’ this up—an owner goes ‘n’ points a gun at me. And I really don’t like to pull out of the horse, just to walk over (buck naked!) to the contract and (tactfully) show it to the owner’s face. But I don’t want to get shot, so I do it. And maybe you’re thinkin’ “Why don’t you just read the contract out-loud to the owner before having ‘em sign it?” Well I don’t do that ‘cause I don’t wanna come off as condescendin’ to the owners; you don’t wanna make it sound like ya think they’re not gonna read the paper they sign, which explains (in Bold Letters) that insertin’ the penis into the horses’ vaginas (or lickin’ ‘em if you’re a girl) is an officially-recognized massage act by the ALMAA.  
     
Anyways, my point is Hidden Folks helps me a lot. It relaxes my mind. And unlike many games it ain’t violent, and it runs on my ultrabook. I also really like the mouth sound effects that go with clickin’ on the plants and the monkeys and stuff.

In fact, the only thing I don’t like about Hidden Folks are the parts that show livestock. I don’t want to click (or see) those animals at the end of the work day. I love my job, but even things you love can drive ya crazy when you’re experiencin’ ‘em too much.

7/10

Kennt ihr noch die coolen Suchbilder aus Kindertagen?
Sowas wie "Wo ist Walter?" oder aus div. Zeitschriften?
Genau das findet ihr hier nur NOCH BESSER! :D

Simple aber stimmige bewegte Zeichnungen in s/w mit orginellen Vertonungen lassen mich sofort der Nostalgie verfallen.
Haben wir uns als Kinder nicht alle gewünscht so einen Suchspaß zu haben welcher auchnoch interaktiv ist?
Was man damals mit seiner Fantasie gemacht hat, ist hier nun wirklichkeit.

Es macht wirklich einen heiden Spaß die vorgegebenen Dinge zu finden, dabei noch andere nette Sachen zu entdecken und immer größere, verworrenere "Bilder" freizuschalten welche wiederum mit ihrer eigenen Geschichte für noch mehr Motivation sorgen.

Preis ist mehr als in Ordnung für das was man hier bekommt. :) 
Nicht nur für Nostalgie-Fans! Wimmelbildspieler/innen werden hier auch ihre wahre Freude dran haben und selbst jemand der mit Wimmelbildspielen nix anfangen kann wird hier vermutlich ehrgeizig den Affen mit der Banane oder den Golfball vom Nachbarn suchen wollen wenn man erstmal angefangen hat. ;)

31259987.review:
This game is full of nostalgia and cuteness. As a kid I had a couple of these brilliantly drawn jigsaw puzzles filled to the brim with objects, animals and people all minding their own buisiness on a casual weekday. There was a seemingly endless amount of pieces (to the eyes of a child, at least) and it was a endless joy to figure out where to fit them and complete the set of thematically interconnected stories the image was telling. Hidden Folks is exactly like that, except that it is a digital hidden object game and not a jigsaw puzzle. 

There's something really familiar and comforting about the art style and the sound effects could not have been done any more fitting. This is something your inner child will fall in love with, no matter what your age might be nowadays. 

Unfortunately the game is also a bit on the short side at this time of writing. The devs are working on more content and extras, so you might want to wait for that before you decide if it's worth the full price or not. I myself thought it was even with only four hours of play, but I am glad there is more to come.

31187034.review: Rien qu'à la vue du trailer, j'étais immédiatement séduite. Le jeu était à la hauteur de mes attentes. De nombreux tableaux dans lesquels on doit rechercher des personnages ou objets parmi des milliers d'éléments! La phrase décrivant le bien à rechercher nous guide, juste ce qu'il faut, pour nous permettre d'avoir la satisfaction de trouver par nous même, sans la frustration d'y passer des heures infinies. Parfois, il est nécessaire d'actionner des mécanismes pour arriver à trouver le bien, ce qui durcit la tâche! Les tableaux sont variés: ville, désert, labo... Les drôles de bruitages faits avec la bouche et les dessins fait main, simplistes à souhait, donnent à ce jeu une identité à nul autre pareil! J'attends avec grande impatience les prochaines mises à jour.

I really enjoyed the playthrough and the attention to details the team went through to add just the right sound effects to the hidden folk and the environment they live in.

While at it's core, it's just a giant Where's Waldo game, there's little mini stories goin on whithin each scene that is impossible not to enjoy.

At this point in time, it's not a huge game in terms of time it takes to run through (the items to find are fixed so no significant replay value) but the developers are promising more scenes added for free as they develop them.

30974320.review:
[h1]What the game is[/h1]
[i]Hidden Folks[/i] was for me, a throwback to the good old days of looking through those [i]Where's Waldo[/i] (Where's Wally for those not in the States/Canada) books. It embodies the concept with a slight twist in the way that you can (somewhat) manipulate objects to help find the person. This feature helps give a bit more depth to the areas you explore, some of which are painstakingly large (Im looking at you [i]The Lab[/i]). Dispite these large spaces, the game still somehow finds a way to make it not the most difficult task to find someone on larger maps, although there are excetions.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+Good Art
Hand-drawnesk art style complements game well
+Lots of Variation
Sure, lots of people will be hidden behind or in something, but the mojority of the time the way to open/access said area is diffent
+Detailed enviroments
The places you look for these people are stuffed with detail that wouldnt even need to be there for this type of genre of game. All of the stuff in each level also seems realistic, and not just tons of people everwhere to hide other people.
+Difficulty
This is one I could realy put in either the "Pros" or "Cons" of this review. Difficulty is a bit odd. Some people, and levels by extension, are really easy. Others are some of the most difficult "find person" levels I have ever done. Following these insainly difficult levels is often an easy one, then an average one, then another average, then a brutal level, with exceptions in worlds 1 and 4. 

[h1]Cons[/h1]
-Repetitive sound effects
The sound effects, while absolutly hallarious and creative, are incredibly repetative after some time.
-Map size
Most maps were perfectly fine by this metric, but others not so much. One dry land level is so massive it takes ages to even find the area where the thing you are looking for is.

[h1]Final Opinion[/h1]
[i]Hidden Folks[/i] is a hidden gem in a sea of games. I deeply enjoyed my hours spent, but I know not everyone will. For what it is, it is an amazing game that I can highly recomend, but only if you like or have liked  games or activities like the aformentioned [i]Where's Waldo[/i]. Although, I would not reccomend playing through the game in one sitting like I did.

30950202.review:
Wer einfach mal etwas anderes als den üblichen Mainstream spielen will, liegt mit diesem Spiel genau richtig. Die Wimmelbild-Idee ist originell und die Vertonung sehr kreativ, wenn auch auf Dauer ein bisschen zu viel des Guten: jedes Geräusch wurde mit Stimmen imitiert, klickt man z. B. auf ein Auto macht es "brummm, brummm", klickt man auf eine Kuh, macht es "muuuuh" - so ungefähr. Anfangs genial - aber ab einem gewissen Zeitpunkt auch etwas nervig.

Man bekommt Vorgaben, welche Personen, Tiere oder Gegenstände man in der Szenerie suchen muss (als Hilfestellung gibt es immer noch einen kleinen Hinweis) und dann stürzt man sich in das Wimmelbild und klickt und staunt und erkundet. Manche Dinge findet man relativ einfach, bei anderen muss man auch etwas um die Ecke denken, z. B. erst Pflanzen bewässern, bevor der gesuchte Gegenstand erscheint oder erst Türen anklicken und öffnen, ehe man die gesuchte Person sieht.

Das Spiel ist wirklich niedlich und liebevoll gemacht, aber das Spielprinzip wiederholt sich andererseits auch relativ schnell. Gleichzeitig wird es aber auch anspruchsvoller, denn je weiter man kommt, desto schwerer sind die gesuchten Objekte zu finden. Mir hat "Hidden Folks" wegen der besonderen Gestaltung und Vertonung aber insgesamt trotzdem sehr gut gefallen und ich würde es jedem weiterempfehlen, der über gezeichnete Figuren à la "La Linea", die zum Beatboxing mit dem Popo wackeln, schmunzeln kann.

30669989.review:
Vous avez envie de vous détendre sans vous prendre la tête ?
Vous avez envie de laisser au repos vos réflexes de Jedi et vos talents de stratège ?
Vous avez envie de plonger dans un univers original, rafraichissant et amusant ?

Hidden Folks est fait pour VOUS !

Le gameplay est très simple, accessible à tous, dans un environnement interactif. Oui, vous avez bien lu : interactif ! Car quand on clique sur un personnage ou élément du décor, on est gratifié d'un bruitage (à la bouche donc incroyable) et parfois d'une petite animation. Certains éléments du décor sont mobiles quand on interagit avec mais pas seulement. Les personnages sont vivants, bougent, font du bruit.
En un mot, Hidden Folks est un jeu vivant. Très vivant. Débordant d'une vitalité contagieuse qui nous fait sourire et nous rend finalement accro au cliquage intensif sur les bestioles, les portes, les rideaux et les gens. Juste pour le fun !

Coté technique, on a droit à des dessins à la main et des bruitages à la bouche. Le must ! Vraiment ! Essayer, c'est l'adopter !

En conclusion, Hidden Folks est une petite pépite à prix parfaitement raisonnable. On a de la détente, du challenge parfois très corsé (les indices aident mais il faut savoir en comprendre le sens) mais aucun obstacle insurmontable. En effet, la transition entre chaque zone ne requiert qu'un quota de cibles trouvées, ce qui permet de revenir par la suite chercher les récalcitrants trop bien cachés (et taquiner les bestioles ou les gens du coin en passant).

Hidden Folks, une valeur sûre ! A s'offrir ou à offrir =)

30607256.review:
一款考察玩家眼力以及分析能力的趣味游戏，本身奇葩的画风以及简单的操作都会让玩家对其产生浓厚的兴趣，而游戏中无处不在的幽默感以及简体中文翻译也能够帮助我们更好的打法零散的时间
画面上相当有创意，整部作品全部都是用黑、白两种颜色的线条手绘完成。而这种风格乍一看也与我们小时候在美术课上画出来的作品极为相似。游戏在场景与环境的设计方面显得极为洒脱，全部的风光、景物、人物等都似乎在一种漫不经心的情绪下勾勒出来。不过这种设定也恰好给了所有玩家一个公平竞争的机会，毕竟无论你对于颜色是多么的敏感，在这部“非黑即白”的作品中，大家的起点都一样。
本作的主要玩法相当好理解。简单的说就是在系统给出的场景当中寻找对应的东西。可以把它比作一本专门考验眼力的绘画本。当然，除了按图找物这种“小儿科”之外，游戏中还有另外一种所占比重较小的玩法，那就是帮助正在场景中移动的角色开辟道路。基本上只要眼睛一直盯着移动的角色，然后发现并解决问题即可。

推荐：喜欢绘画的朋友们

30561321.review:
Like other reviews state, if you liked Where's Waldo? You'll love this game...

...only this game is better! AWESOME! They got so creative with this!

You are provided with several "maps" in addition to smaller transitional maps inbetween the larger ones.

You have a list of people or objects to find which come with a not-too-obvious clue, which makes it nice and challenging. The clues are pretty funny as well.

Not only do you have to find these people or objects, most of the time you will have to interact with the map to open doors, curtains and other things (dont't want to spoil too much) in order to find them.

Along with the game being highly interactive, you are provided with sound effects made by the mouth which are highly entertaining and had me constantly chuckling. I think the zipper sounds on the tents or the advertisement signs rolling up and down were my personal favorite.

The maps are fairly large and there are tons of things going on in them. The artwork remains pretty simple but there are ever so slight differences between the people which adds to the challenge of finding characters!

With the goofiness of the game, you can spend hours just enjoying looking around the map being nosey checking out what all of the people are doing while trying to find your objects. The game is challenging but never frustrating as it's just too entertaining and funny.

PROS:
  Graphics - Very simplistic style but perfect! Works very well for a search game as many   characters look similar and there are tons of things going on in the maps!
  Sounds - Freaking funny and different. Loved it.
  Gameplay - Very interactive, not just looking for items or one-click interaction.

CONS:
Not enough to play. Need more. :(



What I'd like to see: I got through the game in about 6 hours, but each map has so many things going on, I feel that there's room to add new search lists for pre-existing maps, as well as new maps(which I know they're already working on, yay!) There's so many things you can dink around with and objects to find, they could easily do new lists. I want to play more!

+魔性配音 实在能用搞笑和有趣来形容

+具有与玩家的互动性
        之前也有提到过这款游戏不仅仅是单纯的看图找物 很多地方需要玩家按照逻辑剧情来判断 并点击进行一定的互动 才能找到这些Hidden Folks

-进入大型地图关时 内心突然绝望
        不是我指名道姓说谁 就是那张 [spoiler]一望无际的荒野[/spoiler]...
-关卡数尚少
        有人认为地图过少不值这个价格 我个人认为地图也确实少了点 不过作者也有说会推出新图 固不必太抱怨图少


总体评分：8.5/10  推荐游玩

BY：adsy

30502860.review: HF is such a nostalgic experience for those of us who grew up with Highlights and Where's Waldo. I can't wait to purchase more content for this game!

30500816.review:
[h1]Hidden Folks takes the hidden object genre to the next level. It borrows the classics gameplay and appearance of a childhood seek-and-find, like "Where’s Waldo" and improves upon it, adding in moving parts, mini-game interludes, and man-made sound effects that function not only as a charming atmosphere setter, but also intuitive hints to where certain objects are located.[/h1]

https://youtu.be/NZ_2Jnh_su0

If you don’t know how to play a seek-and-find then I’m not entirely sure how, but you must have skipped right over your childhood years and were born as an adult. Jokes aside, the name of the game is self-explanatory: you are given a list of objects, ranging from animals to pickup trucks, and you have to spot them amongst a smattering of other people and objects that form an interactive scene.

That sounds simple enough, but the task becomes akin to finding the metaphorical needle in the haystack due to large, detailed scenes that are chock full of objects. Your list features hints that will allow you to (hopefully) pinpoint the location of a critter, object, or person

Once you’ve found an object, you click on it and it is checked off of your list. You can also use the mouse to click and drag so that you can pan around the scene or alternatively you can use your WASD keys. The game also allows you to choose between a sepia and a night mode so that you can ease the strain on your eyes, which is a thoughtful option setting.

The game is divided into four thematic sections, each of which has its own theme: forest, dry lands, city, and factory. In each, you can find objects that you’d associate with the setting; in the forest, you’ll find lush trees, monkeys and pandas, farm land with the appropriate animals, and camping grounds with RVs and people aplenty—and so on and so forth.

While the sheer number of stuff jammed into each scene is impressive, the organization of those scenes is doubly so, zooming out and viewing the scene as a whole may be a little daunting, but you’ll soon notice groupings of stuff that makes sense thematically. I’m not sure how, but Hidden Folks manages to avoid appearing cluttered. The game allows you to zoom in and take the scene in a bit at a time, which is not an invaluable search tool, it allows you to truly appreciate the little touches; the loving attention to detail.

Where Hidden Folks really shines is its atmosphere. From the constant chatter of monkeys in the first stages to the purr of car engines in the city levels, every single sound in this game comes from the mouth of an actual person. The thought alone made me giggle when clicking on an alligator and hearing it roar, which happened to be one of my favourite sound effects. These non-invasive utterances not only set the atmosphere, they also act as auditory cues that help you find what you’re looking for amidst the scores of other objects. The vast majority of objects you interact with have their own sounds and they also react to your clicks; bushes get cut down, fixed objects that obscure the hidden folk behind them can be moved aside, and birds will scatter. These neat little touches make the time spent diligently searching worthwhile.

For those of you who are hungry for more, there are an additional three levels in the works and they will be available for free to anyone who owns the game.

.Pros.
[List][*] Suitable for gamers of all ages.
[*] Intuitively desigbed hint system.
[*] The art style and sound effects are quirky and creative.
[*] Different colour modes so as to avoid eye-strain.
[*]A healthy dose of nostalgia. 
[*] There's more content on the way.[/list]

.Cons.
[List] [*] Asking price seems a bit steep for the amount of levels currently. [/list]

.Bottom Line.
Hidden Folks takes a very classic style of gameplay and adds a creative spin that improves it in every way. There’s a lot to like here for gamers of all skill levels, though I think those who have a preference for puzzle games will really appreciate the finer details of the hint system and cues created by sounds. This is a game for players of all ages and a charming addition to anyone’s library.

This game really took me by surprise. I never heard of it before and decided to give it a try without really expecting too much. 

I'm glad I did because this is one of the most lovely Hidden Object Games i had the pleasure to play. All screens are hand drawn and full of detail. There is so much going on that it can be overhelming when you start out but the hints that the game shows are perfect for giving you something to look out for without spoiling too much. They also add a backstory to every object or person, which i thought was great since it makes the world seem more "alive" and not just like a picture where you have to find stuff in.

The game is not too long, but new content is already announced. I would still highly recommend it at the current price since the game offers a very unique experience.

你也许会问：好玩吗？
真的不好玩。我怎么会告诉你那些小人、小东西叫的有多起劲，你也不可能知道里面每一扇门、每一面百叶窗、每一顶帐篷都被我打开过。
一点都不好玩。你会发怒、会抓耳挠腮、会难受得睡不着，毫不在意布满血丝的双眼，只是一个劲地点着屏幕，然后会妥协、会绝望，想着也许一篇游戏攻略会拯救自己。接着会纠结，究竟要不要毁掉自己的游戏体验来通过关卡，最后因为翻看了攻略而追悔莫及。哪能像我这样随便点点就能找齐的。
真的一点都不好玩。当你找齐了所有隐藏的东西时，剩下的只有挥之不去的疲惫和空虚，迷蒙的双眼望着那仅有的五个成就发呆。你怎么可能像我一样霸业已成志得意满。
强烈建议你不要没事购入这款游戏。

然而一个藏在故障糖果机里的魔法蘑菇真的让我感受到了绝望。我恨这个蘑菇。

30350577.review:
相信许多八零九零后的玩家们都在儿时曾玩过最古老的“找茬游戏”，一张纸质大图，或是图书或是杂志，图上面画着稀奇古怪的场景和角色，玩家在其中寻找隐藏起来的某个物品或人，全部找到则算作完成一场游戏。
Hidden Folks》译为“消失的人”，游戏模式与儿时的那种游戏方式几乎一致，只不过不同的是当年我们仅仅是在书上玩，玩过了也就没了，而这款作品却设计了诸多关卡，搭配近一千种人声录制的音效来让玩家体验，着实有一丝变卖童年情怀的意味。
其实该种游戏模式与“消除类”游戏有着异曲同工之妙，各位玩家的长辈们是否有在刚刚换代智能手机时沉迷“三消游戏”无法自拔呢？其实这类游戏一直以来都有着三大特点：
   一：趣味性
   “三消游戏”虽然理论上都是通过点击相同颜色消除该色方块以达到推进游戏进度的游戏方式来进行设计，但同时也是上手度最简单的一类游戏之一，通过简单的步骤使其上手后再添加一些道具和规则就能将无聊“三消”的趣味性大大增强，也不失为一种消磨时间的好工具。
   二：挑战性
   “三消游戏”虽然不需要太过复杂的游戏技巧，但加入了限时系统或任务目标就会立刻让通关变的不是十分容易，过易的游戏长时间游玩很容易无聊，过难则又容易失去耐心，所以论其受众面，挑战性强的游戏远比过易或过难的游戏高得多。
   三：游戏体验
   其实大多数人都未曾注意到一个细节，那就是“消除”这种游戏行为本身就会给玩家带来较为不错的心理快感，同类的游戏例子很多，例如“俄罗斯方块”“泡泡龙”“祖玛”等等都是采用了这种方式，再配上“消除”时的音效则能将这种快感大大增强。
《Hidden Folks》虽然并不属于“三消系列”的任何一种，但也是借鉴了“三消”的消除快感来进行游戏，它不同于常规“找茬”游戏左右各放一张图来让大家找不同，而是让玩家在一整张地图中进行探索，玩家对未知的事物总是好奇的，所以游戏完美运用了这一点通过复杂生动的关卡地图来增加神秘感，让玩家不断的在地图上探索并同时完成任务目标，如此一来即增强了游戏的可玩性，又增加了游戏的趣味性，不可谓不好玩。
游戏画面采用的是黑白色调的手绘风，相比于色彩斑斓的同类休闲益智游戏来说，这样的画面风格很容易给玩家带来视觉疲劳和压抑感。但令人拜服的是制作方用音效完美的化解了这样的一个弊病，利用多达960种全人声录制音效来给每一个场景物品赋予一丝无厘头的喜感，玩家在游戏体验中则会格外关注每一次点击的惊喜，画面的粗糙感也就没有想象中那么严重了。
游戏除了近一千个的音效外还拥有十五种以上的“手绘区域”以供玩家探索，200多个独特的交互方式来增强游戏的趣味性，但对于观察力的考验也是实打实的困难。在此推荐给喜欢这类游戏的玩家，希望各位能在游戏当中寻找到儿时的记忆与快乐。

正直、普通の絵本を買うよりもこちらのほうがお得ですし、数倍楽しめます。
絵が「動く」、「音」が出る、なんて絵本はないでしょう。
これは、「ゲームの絵本」なんですから。

とにかく、絵が素晴らしいんです！
細かいところまで丁寧によく描き込んでありますし、
こんなにたくさんの建物や、オブジェクト、人など
すべて描き終えるまで、かなりの時間を要することでしょう。
これはもう、素晴らしいとしか言いようがありません。

絵をクリックすると、ドアを開けることができたり、音楽が流れたり、
といった「ゲーム」ならではの面白い要素もたくさんあります。
絵の中から特定の人物や、動物、さらにはオブジェクトをいくつか探せば、
次のステージに行けるようになるのですが、コンプリートしようとすると
これが、なかなかに難しくて良かったです。全部見つけるまで苦労しました。

意外なところで見つけたり、「こんな場所に？」と思うようなこともあったり、
一つ一つ発見してくのが楽しくて、ワクワクしながらプレイしていました。
仕掛けも凝っていますし、全体的にとてもよくできています。
まだ、完成していないステージもあるようなので、完成するまでが待ち遠しいです。

定価で買っても損はないでしょう。値段分以上の価値は、間違いなくあります。おすすめです！
この楽しさや素晴らしさは、まず、プレイしてみないことにはわかりません。

[b][u]結論：セールまで待たずに、とりあえず買いましょう！[/u]

30337350.review:
The graphics are hand drawn, black and white, and the sound is all created through mouth, every sound effect from clicking on monkeys, to opening tent doors, they are all voiced by Mr De Jongh and this gives it some great comic relief. Some of the sound effects are basic, but the buzz buzz buzz of the buzzing bees is always fun to listen to.
Anyone familiar with Where’s Wally will know the reference at the top of the review, those that aren’t aware of the series of books, essentially you are tasked with finding Wally in the page of the book as well as finding other items throughout the world. It is this game mechanics that Hidden Folks is all about. You get given a list of items to find before allowing you to move onto the next area. The areas themselves  are absolutely ginormous, with you moving around using your mouse, zooming in as you go. Each item you are tasked to find comes with a clue, which gives you an idea to where you can find it on the level.  These clues are invaluable as some of the more congested areas would make it difficult for you to find a pair of sunglasses without a rough indication as to their location. As you progress through the levels they get more and more congested, at one stageI had to take a 10 minute break to give my eyes a rest from all the action going on at once. In between some levels you are given a smaller area to look through as a kind of interlude and to give your eyes a rest, included is also a section where you have to clear the path  for the character, allowing them safe passage through the level.
The game is a fantastic example of what an independent developer can achieve, the game just works. My personal favourite level is the desert level, which has areas of a festival where you can switch on the music and watch the characters dance around, then scroll to the east and you stumble across a Mad Max style area. Its these little nods to popular culture that also add a great little aside, finding Q-bert was a great addition.
Overall, this is a game that will appeal to people who like both hidden object games, as well as someone looking for a bit of light relief. With its low price point at £5.99 I don’t think it’s a game you can pass up on if you are a fan of Where’s Wally.

30308629.review:
Hidden Folks is a rare indie gem that wears its heart and soul, strengths and weaknesses on its sleeve. 

This game is honest from the start, it invites you warmly into it's easy to understand hide and seek system and never pretends to be more than it really is. Instead of trying to wow you with complex interactions, it seeks to play to its strengths and elicit little bites of joy, rewarding you for curiosity and exploration of each hand crafted scene. Full of character and a clear love from its creator, Hidden Folks is a great game for adults and children alike.

If you've got a shred of nostalgia for hide and seek picture books that were so developmental to many of us in childhood, Hidden Folks will leave you with a grin and a desire to share the experience with others.

In short, if you're looking for a relaxing, rewarding and heartfelt experience, go no further.

30219901.review:
¿Te acuerdas de "¿Donde está Wally?"? Pasalo a blanco y negro, animalo con todo cuanto detalle se te ocurra, ponle sonidos (hechos por una ersona con la boca) para cada clic que hagas sobre cualquier elemento y... Tienes Hidden Folks, uno de esos juegos para gente con paciencia que recompensa la misma con gran entretenimiento. 

Todo el juego se basa en mapas con monigotes dibujados en blanco y negro, mapas que son enormes donde te podrás perder buscando lo que te plazca. En cada uno tendrás que encontrar una serie de personas/animales/objetos haciendo uso de las pistas que te dan, pistas que a veces serán muy directas y otras más... metafóricas, pero igualmente útiles. La cuestión es que cliquearás decenas de veces en cada mapa y descubrirás detalles que aunque no son lo que buscas, te harán gracia igualmente o te despertarán cierta curiosidad. Para pasar al siguiente mapa no tendrás que encontrar absolutamente todo lo que se te pide, solo tendrás que hacer un mínimo. Personalmente, soy incapaz de pasar al siguiente sin completar el anterior, eso es sinónimo de que hay algo que no he visto y TODO en este juego merece que le prestes atención.

Considerando que un libro de "¿Donde está Wally?" cuesta entre 10 y 15 EUR, no me parece que por 8 EUR este juego sea caro. Si eres una de esas personas curiosas y con paciencia, te lo recomiendo con creces. Sino, puedes probarlo por la curiosidad, si te gusta perfecto y sino le habrás dado 8 EUR a dos personas que se lo merecen por su esfuerzo.

30185924.review:
[h1]Hidden Folks —— 大隐隐于市[/h1]
休闲有趣的找物游戏

+推理解谜要素
（多数目标是藏在某个物体后的，根据提示推断大概位置，所以实际游戏比预览图的感觉更容易也更有趣）
+反馈丰富且没有点击惩罚
（绝大多数物体可以单击或拖动，既是解谜的一部分，也非常有趣）
+魔性音效
（真人配音，不那么栩栩如生的“口技“反而更加魔性搞笑）
+难度适中/瞎眼适中
（解谜推理要素和优秀的社区翻译让大海捞针并没有那么困难，一片区域只有一个目标的规律也能更好地帮助玩家缩小范围
调整亮度和缩放大小，选择不同的配色模式，其实没那么瞎）

-密恐杀手
-关卡略少[spoiler]当然作者说会有后续关卡更新[/spoiler]
（特别是主题显少，不妨大开脑洞，弄些诸如冒险岛的天空之城、扎昆、神木村这样有奇幻色彩、眼前一亮的主题）

游戏体验比浏览图好很多，对于喜欢找物游戏的玩家来说更是能称得上出色

食用方法：

30141684.review:
Play Hidden Folks. It's just so charming and fun to tap around in this world that feels alive. It's such a simple idea at its core of being a hidden object game, yes. But the artwork, sound design, and the realization of the ambition to create puzzles where you have to find specific folks in the middle of busy, bustling scenes, are all at their peak. Check this game out.



Hidden Folks is a collaboration between  developer Adriaan de Jongh  and illustrator Sylvain Tegroeg that takes a very simple concept of being a "Where's Waldo" game.

Then it makes everything happen in a monochromatic world, with huge canvases to explore as folks wander around, and you have to find a certain bunch of these folks. It's a simple idea, but the work that the team behind the game has done with the art, sound, and playability, makes this a fantastic experience.



Hidden Folks is pretty much just a "Where's Waldo"/"Where's Wally" game. Your goal is to find a bunch of the eponymous hidden folks listed, or occasionally certain items. The big trick for Hidden Folks is that everything is interactive and occasional moving. Poem items will be hidden behind obstructions, or hidden in manholes. Others, you have to open up tent flaps or doors to find folks hiding from your view. Oh, and the levels become incredibly dense, too: you have to find folks scattered throughout groups of hundreds of other folks that look quite similar from your bird's eye view, especially because the game is monochrome. Oh, and there are some elements where folks will only be on screen at certain points, or you have to make not-entirely-obvious interactions in order to make the folks appear.

30106660.review:
Initial thoughts were; "It's charming, fun, quirky, and well put together; but at this rate it's going to be over [i]really[/i] fast."

Thankfully, I was wrong about only the last of those thoughts.

I decided after the first few, quick levels to work through the objects in order, and not move on until I got that one. And to fully complete each stage before opening the next. I mostly stuck to this throughout, apart from a few lucky finds while randomly clicking on stuff. Which is my excuse for taking nearly 6 hours to complete Hidden Folks.

At times it actually was a little frustrating as some of the clues are either obscure or actually a bit misleading. But not many; for the most part it's a very relaxing and entertaining way to spend a bit of time. The sounds and animations really bring the game world alive in a unique way.

There are new levels coming (soon I hope), and I'm sure to replay it from scratch when they do come out. So even though the price point seemed a little high at first, I have no regrets now about buying it.

I'd definitely recommend this to anyone who looks at the store page and thinks; 'this looks like it could be interesting.'

30073974.review:
You're presented with a large, animated, pencil drawn scene which you can zoom in and out of and drag around. At the bottom of the screen is a taskbar showing the Folks and objects to be found. Most of these are hidden, of course, so you have to move things out of the way to reveal them. Items pop out from underneath manhole covers, monkeys fall out of trees, snakes regurgitate chickens. You'll spend the first couple of hours just happily enjoying the novelty of it all before you get down to the serious business of hide-and-seek.

[h1]Sound & Vision[/h1]

The artwork here is extremely complex, masquerading under the guise of simplicity. Each scene has hundreds of Folks in it, and if you look closely you can see that each and every one of them is unique. The whole scene is animated and further animations appear as you move objects around to look for Folks' hidey holes. Everyone is engaged in some kind of activity and the Folks you're looking for are up to all sorts of shenanigans such as being electrocuted, getting stuck on ladders, sleeping on the job etc.

The bright white background could potentially cause eye strain, but there are settings for sepia (my choice) and also inverted (white on black) if you prefer.

You can play in a window but you will definitely want fullscreen for this. You need the maximum amount of screen area to be able to see as much as possible in order to minimise the amount of zooming and dragging necessary.

It wouldn't surprise me if the audio work here receives some kind of award in the future. Everything you click has its own sound effect and it's all done by one man's mouth. 960 individual sounds. How is that even possible?

As you zoom in and out and drag the canvas around, the sounds change in volume and it really brings the scenes to life. Some Folks dancing at an outdoor disco on the campsite with the boombox getting louder and then fading as you pass by is just so cool.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]

You don't have to find all of the targets to progress to the next level. You can get through the first few levels by clicking everywhere like a crazy grinning loon, amidst a cacophony of farts, sighs and grunts, until you stumble on some Folks. This strategy will only carry you so far though. The last few Folks are always surprisingly hard to find, and each level has a larger canvas than the last. They become huge, and the difficulty is also ramped up due to more of the targets being hidden behind other objects rather than in plain sight. Eventually you must pay attention to what's happening in the scene and use the popup clues given for each target. By doing this you can narrow down the area, for example if a Folk is a postal worker you can home in on the post office and search that area.

This can be a fun family game for kids of course, but make no mistake, there is a decent challenge here. These Folks can be frustratingly elusive, especially the last one or two when you're trying to get the achievements for finding them all.

[h1]Steam[/h1]

Everything you need: 5 achievements; 5 trading cards; cloud; cross-platform.

[h1]Value[/h1]

If you want to be clinical about it then yes, the midrange price is reasonable considering the quality, amount of content and fantastic gameplay. On top of that, there are more (free) levels still to come, already marked out on the menu. I think this game is beyond price valuation though (see below).

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

This is one of those rare, innovative, trailblazing games that only comes along once in a blue moon and spawns a new genre. Forget the price, this is something that you'll want to experience as soon as possible because everyone will be talking about it. There's a good reason why it has almost 100% positive ratings on Steam. A few Chinese seem to have a problem with it for some reason.

30073966.review:
As a kid, I *loved* the Highlights "Hidden Pictures" pages and Where's Waldo. If you did too and want to revisit that joy with a challenge suited for someone of any age (but certainly still with decent eyesight), this is the game for you. What's more, the game rewards you for poking around and exploring with goofy animations and man-made sound effects for every little click. 

It's not a long game, but it's a few hours of silly fun. Totally worth the price. Plus, the menu hints at additional levels coming soon.

30053729.review:
Znáte hru "Where's Waldo?"/"Where's Wally? "? Pokud ano, tohle je něco velmi podobného. Máte několik map, na nich hromadu objektů a váš úkol je prostý - najít určité postavy, zvířata či věci. Zpočátku je to velmi lehké, mapy jsou malé, počet věcí minimální. Postupem času se lokace zvětšují a navíc dojde i k tomu, že už nestačí jen prošmejdit obrazovku a nalézt panáčka, ale musíte vykonat i určitou činnost. Odsunout kámen, posekat trávu, otevřít dveře... I tyto akce jsou postupem času složitější.

Abyste to měli o něco lehčí, je u každé věci menší nápověda, která je ale formou hádanky, tudíž vám neřekne přesně, kde co je, ale musíte se trochu zamyslet. I tak by vám dohrání hry aktuálně nemělo zabrat více než pět hodin, což je vzhledem k ceně málo. Autor ale slibuje přidání dalších map, takže se uvidí, jak to dopadne.

Hra je černobílá, což po čase trochu táhne oči, ale můžete si barevnou paletu přehodit nebo dát i sépiovou barvu. Co mě ale nejvíce uchvátilo a donutilo i ke koupi byly zvuky. Téměř tisícovka různorodých zvuků, které jsou vytvořeny ústy... V drtivé většině případů jsou vtipné a sám jsem se přistihl, že jsem prostě jen klikal na lidi a předměty a zjišťoval, co jaký zvuk vydává. A smál jsem se. Opravdu dost jsem se nasmál.

Pro každého milovníka hledání skrytých objektů hru doporučuji. Jedinou otázkou je poměr cena/délky hry, která je zatím lehce v neprospěch titulu. Až čas ukáže, zda tahle hra stojí opravdu za to.

30052814.review:
记得小学买过一本《樱桃小丸子》的彩绘玩具书，随着故事的展开（比如花轮同学请小丸子玉子来家里玩呀、班级的春游啊）会在书里设置一些找茬游戏给我玩，比如小丸子把便当丢在了同学们热闹聚餐的森林里要我找之类的，虽然为了照顾儿童一般都设计的无脑又简单，但是初次接触的我还是很开心的拿着笔在书里圈圈画画玩了好久。
想不到时隔这么多年，这款游戏又让我回想起了当初的那份乐趣。
尽管它不是彩绘的，难度虽大却也设置的很合理。
其实关于找茬类的游戏我还玩过一些，像找你妹啊还有双图找不同之类的，都是生硬的给你摆出物件，然后让你自己在规定时间去找。说实话我不是很喜欢这种感觉，就像是游戏赶时间催着你去完成它们，而不是让你一点点去体会这种寻找的乐趣。
这个游戏给了我挺大的惊喜，每一个需要你寻找的东西都有几句很有趣的描述，他们想做什么，什么在他们身边，什么在妨碍着他们，跟随这些线索一点点看着屏幕上悦动的小人小动物越发觉得有趣。
游戏刚开始满屏的清明上河图乍一看无从下手，不过调整鼠标滚轮可以把画面放大缩小让我松了一口气，不然我这轻度密集恐惧真的会选择甩手给制作人一耳瓜子！音效都是人声配的，如果你像我一样为了省麻烦拿鼠标全图点点点，你也一定会像我一样被吱吱呀呀的音效烦死的！不过地图上每一个活着的生物都在动，让一般都是性冷淡风的找茬游戏增色了不少，我挺喜欢。
如果游戏开发者愿意偷一点懒，把里面物品的描述都去掉，然后全部设置成随机，游戏的耐玩度也许看起来会提高不少。所幸游戏还是蛮有自己品味和态度的，这种游戏的优势是一周目会给人非常大的好感和新鲜度，记性好的人玩二周目游戏性肯定下降。不过游戏里还有一些没有完成的地图在制作中，还是可以期待一下的。
建议有心二周目的人，第一周目就不要把目标都找出来了，留点精彩给二周目的自己。
只玩了一小会，这篇算是试毒评测，实际上看我评测的买不买关我屁事嘞！我自己喜欢就好了嘻嘻(*^__^*)

30049715.review:
啊，这个游戏真是太棒了，鹅妹子嘤！沉迷找茬不能自拔，一坐就是几个小时，让你体验程序员的脊椎病。眼睛一瞪也是几个小时，一夜让你体验什么叫真正的写轮眼，现充的话也可以和你的女朋友一起练写轮眼，一瞎就是几个小时不费劲。同时也能让你体验下腱鞘炎是什么感觉。我觉得把这游戏通关整个人都要瘫痪在床了。

关于找茬方面，不同于大家熟知的传统找茬，这个游戏有一定的自由度，[spoiler] 通过鼠标点击、拖拉等操作，有很多东西不点开机关是找不到的，比如树叶中的洞是可以点开查看树内情况的，灌木丛也是可以扒开，竹林是可以砍断的。点香蕉会落地，点鸟会飞等等。	[/spoiler]在增加了难度的同时也大大增加了游戏性。总是会卡在一些奇怪的地方。

说下画面，三色可选有点类似读书用的保护色，亮度可调。还有就是建议使用大屏全屏进行游戏，因为有些地图不但大密度还很高，缩放的话很是影响效率。
另外不得不说一下这个BGM，刚玩的时候全程都在笑233不过挺久了面部的会觉得枯燥，可以边听自己喜欢的音乐边玩。

30032796.review:
[b]Hidden Folks[/b] ist ein Wimmelbild-Spiel im Stil der bekannten "Wo ist Walter?" bzw. "Where's Wally?" Bücher von Martin Handford. Im Gegensatz zu den Büchern muss in diesem Spiel jedoch nicht nur ein Kerl mit Pudelmütze und rot-weiß gestreiftem Pullover gesucht werden, sondern verschiedene Charaktere und Objekte, die sich in der detaillierten, interaktiven Welt verstecken. 

Aktuell gibt es 14 verschiedene Welten, die sich in die Gebiete Wald, Ödland, Stadt und Fabrik unterteilen und die mit fortlaufendem Spielfortschritt freigeschaltet werden. Stand heute sollen die Gebiete Stadt und Fabrik noch um 1 oder 2 Spielwelten erweitert werden.

[b]Einfaches Spielprinzip, gute Laune, großer Spaß[/b]

Das Spielprinzip ist ziemlich einfach! Am unteren Bildschirmrand werden die zu suchenden Personen und Objekte aufgelistet. Der Spieler kann über die Karte scrollen um das Objekt zu finden. Natürlich ist das in den teilweise sehr großen Welten, in denen es an allen Ecken und Enden wimmelt, nicht immer ganz einfach. Manche sind sehr gute versteckt oder nicht auf Anhieb zu entdecken. Ein Mausklick auf die zu suchenden Objekte offenbart deshalb auch immer einen Tipp, der dabei helfen soll die Person zu finden. 

Teilweise ergibt sich das Versteck aus Beobachtung der Landschaft, teilweise sind Personen und Objekte in oder hinter anderen Objekten verborgen und manchmal muss man einfach ein bisschen "um die Ecke" denken und erst etwas in Gang setzen. Die Gesamtspielzeit schätze ich, je nach vorgehen des Spielers, auf irgendwas zwischen 4 und 12 Stunden. 

Wer nicht mit den schwarzen Strichmännchen auf weißem Hintergrund klar kommt, kann entweder die Helligkeit des Hintergrunds reduzieren oder die Nacht- und Sepia Modi ausprobieren. Auch die Soundeffekte und die Scrollgeschwindigkeit lassen sich je nach Bedarf beliebig einstellen.

[b]Fazit:[/b] Die allgemeine Detailverliebtheit und die Tatsache, dass fast alles animiert ist und mehr als 960 Soundeffekte & Geräusche von Entwickler Adriaan de Jongh  selbst eingesprochen wurden, machen Hidden Folks zu einem kleinen Kunstwerk und einer klaren Kaufempfehlung für jeden, der Wimmelbilder mag.

30030342.review:
Hidden Folks est un jeu indépendant qui reprend le concept du très célèbre Ou est charlie? en le rendant encore plus ludique. Au lieu de trouver un seul personnage au milieu d’une image géante, il faudra trouver des habitants, objets et autres animaux particuliers dans un environnement en noir et blanc animé. Dans des petites scènes animées, il faudra faire preuve d’imagination et de jugeote pour trouver tous les éléments du niveau. Il faudra ouvrir des portes, presser des boutons, secouer des arbres et faire exploser des ballons pour parvenir à nos fins.

Tout est dessiné à la main dans le jeu, scanné et placé manuellement dans le décor pour ensuite être animé. On retrouve donc des ambiances et autres environnements originaux dans lesquels il va falloir avoir l’œil. Vous n’avez qu’à trouver les bonnes personnes dans 15 décors rigolos et originaux qui vont du camping jusqu’au désert. Autre petit détail sympathique, tous les sons sont réalisés avec la bouche du développeur! N’importe quel ordinateur ou tablette suffit à le faire tourner correctement. Le jeu n’est pas bien lourd à télécharger et il dispose déjà de quelques bonnes heures de durée de vie en l’état. Pas de stress dans Hidden Folks, il n’y a pas de limite de temps, pas de points ou d’objectifs secondaires. On peut même passer au niveau suivant avant d’avoir tout trouvé ce qui permet de s’aérer l’esprit avant de chercher les derniers éléments qui nous manque.

Je suis caché!

Le jeu est relativement agréable à voir, on ne parle pas d’une réalisation grandiloquente mais elle a le mérite d’être sobre et limpide. Le choix de l’absence de couleur permet au développeur de faire chercher des objets petits et communs qui se trouveraient facilement à cause de leur couleur comme des bananes. Les niveaux sont parfois très larges et il faudra zoomer et dézoomer pour y voir plus clair. Hidden Folks a l’excellente idée de nous aider dans nos recherches avec un petit texte qui décrit où est censé se situer l’élément recherché. On y découvre d’ailleurs que Pikachu apprécie le wifi au camping!

Ce qui fait toute la beauté du jeu, c’est sa simplicité et le côté extrêmement simple du gameplay. On est dans le domaine des jeux pour les non joueurs mais Hidden Folks parvient à captiver le joueur grâce à son monde vivant quoi qu’évoluant en noir et blanc. C’est également un jeu où l’on peut jouer à plusieurs et ou tout le monde s’amuse quelque soit son âge. Je vous conseille par ailleurs d’y jouer avec vos enfants, ils auront souvent la solution pour trouver un personnage bien caché malgré les indices.

Tonton henri aime bien se rouler dans les blés.

Le jeu dispose déjà de pas mal de contenu et il est prévu d’avoir encore plus d’ici quelques temps comme on peut le voir dans l’interface du jeu. Il reste néanmoins à voir si ce contenu sera gratuit ou payant mais si vous aimez le principe du jeu, je ne vois aucune raison de se priver tant le prix demandé est léger. La version iOS est encore moins chère mais on ne pourra pas profiter pleinement d’un grand écran pour chercher. Je n’ai pas rencontré de gros bugs mis à part un freeze après avoir laissé tourner le jeu quelques longues minutes seul. Tout est enregistré via le Steam Cloud ce qui vous permet donc de jouer sur plusieurs machines différentes à la fois, pratique. Le jeu dispose de cartes Steam et elles partent pour assez cher à l’heure où j’écris ce test!

Hidden Folks est donc une franche réussite que je vous conseille fortement d’acheter si vous aimez les jeux de puzzles. C’est une perle qui a peut-être comme seul tort de sortir en ce mois chargé de février 2017. C’est un excellent divertissement pour toute la famille dont j’espère voir de nouvelles itérations que ce soit en DLC ou en suite. C’est loin d’être un simple petit jeu indépendant qu’il fait bon de buzzer, c’est une merveille de jeu qui mérite à la fois le succès et la reconnaissance. Je suis conquis!

30029311.review:
他の方が書いてらっしゃる通り、まさに「ウォーリィーを探せ！」です。
PC版というからには、絵本とは違った楽しみ方が出来ます。

上の動画を見てみましたか？
クリックすると、アクションが行われ・・・音がでる！
よくよく聞くとこの音、すべて口で作る擬音語で作られているんです！
車を押すと「ヴィッヴィー」
サボテンをつつくと「オウッ！」
植物をつつけば「ガサガサ」
人をつつけば「アロー」「ヘイヘイフィフォー」←本当にそう聞こえるｗ
無論、押さなくてもブツブツと勝手に呟いていますｗ
手書きと相まって、手作り感満載で見てるだけでもとても楽しいです。

自分の場合は、他のゲーム内（MMO等）の待ち時間等の合間にちょこちょこと遊んでいます。
迷子の砂漠での・・・「金のつぼ」の謎、暗号らしきものは見つかりましたが、解くことが出来ないのが悔しいんだよなぁ。

自分の感想として・・・
1冊の絵本を買ったと思えば、定価で買っても損はないと思います。
のんびりと、ぼーっと出来るのもこのゲームのいいところではないでしょうか。



あ、クリックだけじゃないのはここだけの話ｗ
そんな時はどうするのかって？
そんな時は・・・おっと誰かが来たようだ。ではまた今度！

Ce jeu est très bien et très compliqué, et aussi très rigolo; par exemple il y a un Pikachu (nommé Pika) caché sous une tente, il ya aussi un singe volant entre deux arbres.

30011189.review:
[b]While not perfect, [i]Hidden Folks[/i] brings back fond memories of [i]Where's Waldo?[/i] along with some cool bells-and-whistles that makes it more of a 'game'.[/b] 

This title gets an A+ for some really neat art and creative sounds. The ambience is very well done. Yeah, it becomes a bit of a click-fest after a while, and yeah, the animations become repetitive quicker than I'd like. That's why it's best played in short bursts. [b]Well worth the few bucks to experience something unique for an afternoon.[/b]

[i]Essentially, this is a hidden-object-game styled after a classic childrens book series.[/i] There is a bar on the bottom of each screen that has characters or objects you must find. Hovering over said object gives a slight clue - which is supposed to be used (unlike 'help' in other hidden object games). The sounds are all acapella. You can invert the black and white screen if you are playing in the dark - the game has nice touches like that. 

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Fresh take on a classic childrens book series
+The artwork and sounds are quite creative and work well together
+There are a few 'mini-game' esque level variations that are neat
+As of 2/17, they are apparently adding more content in the future
+Good choice of quality-of-life game options

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Best in short bursts because there is limited animations and artwork; examples of this are things like - there are only a certain number of poses that quickly repeat, and other things like clickable holes in the ground or trees become redundant

[b]While I won't be logging dozens of hours here, it certainly makes me smile and give me fun coffee breaks:)[/b]

30002444.review:
https://youtu.be/xkKXmuK_KQc

Hidden Folks is very much a simplistic "Where's Woldo" style hidden object game that proves the rule that simplicity is sometimes bliss. I'm not going to beat around the bush on this one, the game has a metric ton of charm, runs well, and is a good deal of clean fun that will entertain people of all ages.

With the, I suppose you could say voice acted? sound effects, the game entertained right off the bat and, given from what I saw in my First Impressions Review has a good amount of content.

I would like to remind everyone, however, that the replayability factor is quite low as there is no real randomization. But, even still, I am confident that recommending this game is the right call.

8/10

30001040.review:
I grew up reading I Spy and Where's Waldo/Wally, and while it doesn't have the rhyming puzzles of the former nor the cavalcade of colour of the latter, this game has it's own distinct fantastic style.

Many mouth-made sounds and hand-drawn animations serve to provide a very pleasant experience. It's often just as much fun to just click around on whatever object is at hand just to hear what sound it will play. Sometimes you're rewarded with a beep-beep-bip-boop of a computer or a unce-unce-tiss of a drum kit.

There's a lot to look for and some of the later areas in the game are [i]gigantic[/i].

It's a little light on content right now but the developer has promised more to come. Something I think would work well with this game is a level editor or custom challenges.

29989053.review:
刚打开这个游戏我还以为这是给我弟弟玩的益智小游戏，什么嘛，点点点就行了。然后从第二大关开始我就发现这个游戏有毒了，什么鬼啊，地图这么大根本找不到在哪，还有，这里面的音效好诡异啊！为什么鸟是这么叫的啊！鳄鱼叫声要不要这么萌？！
  好吧，认真说一下……
  画面：直接看很简单，重复度似乎也很高，但是仔细看，会发现重复之处又有不同，不同之处又有细节之处，感觉非常用心！
  音效：如果我没猜错，所有音效都是直接用人声的，配音相当魔性，每次点飞小鸟还会忍不住再点几下，特别是有些东西的配音相当需要想象力，并且你能听到你视野所在的画面的声音，感觉细节相当棒！
  游戏性：游戏里几乎绝大多数可互动的东西都…………是白忙活的，然而你永远猜不到地洞，帐篷，窗帘后面藏的是什么，永远满足不了你的好奇心和点开它们的冲动，不过没有关系，只要有提示在…………你也不一定能找到东西在哪0.0……提示总给你一种看得到摸不着的感觉，真是让人又气又笑。
  总的来说，游戏体验相当不错，不过感觉内容和价格还是有点不成正比啊，只玩了3.6小时表示已经到最后一关了，根本不过瘾，如果不是手头宽裕的朋友我还是不推荐买，但是对于游戏本身我还是给推荐票的！

29976103.review:
Do you like Where's Waldo, cool art styles, quirky audio and chill gameplay? If yes, you'll love Hidden Folks.

Hidden Folk presents you with a simple task: find stuff. Be it people, animals or objects, your objective is to find everything in the area to progress onward. Everything is done with the mouse, you click and can zoom in and out with the mousewheel. Every scene is filled with a colorful cast of characters walking about and moving, there's a lot of things that move that keep the scenes from getting dull and stagnant, it really does feel like a complicated Where's Waldo picture come to life though I haven't seen anything too crazy so far. It's all simple, but it works well. The audio is all done via voice work, so all sound effects and "voices" are by the same guy goofing off at his microphone but it really fits the aesthetic the game has going for it.

The scenes themselves vary wildly in size and can be absolutely massive requiring you to drag the scene around even if you're at maxed out zoom. Finding things can also be really tricky, but thankfully you can click the objects in the bar and you'll be given hints and they usually give you an idea of their general location. It's really nice but even with them I've managed to get stuck. Also, you don't need to find everything in every scene so if you find a majority of things and get stuck, you can move on if you want to.

Awesome game and for $8 it's a total steal. Give it a shot!

29971825.review: Hidden Folks is a small, cute "Where's Waldo" kind of game, where you navigate through quite big maps in search of people and objects listed in the bottom of the screen. The simple handdrawn graphics looks adorable while the black-and-white colors make the player's job more difficult. However, what made me buy this game are the funny, mouth-made sounds that fill each map, describing the object you are clicking at the moment - from "bzbzbzbz" when clicking the beehive, through "beep beep" when you click the car, to "raaaarrrr" when you click a crocodile! I think it's incredibly cute and if you don't believe me, just watch the trailer. The level design of Hidden Folks offers both a fair gameplay for people who just want to get through the maps quickly as well as more exhausting challenge for completionists. The game is not very long, but will offer you a few hours of sheer enjoyment. Definitely recommending this one!

29967354.review:
Full disclosure: Adriaan is a friend of mine whom I have a large amount of respect and admiration for. So if you think that disqualifies me from reviewing his games without bias ... You may very well be right I still liked it. 

Hidden folks is a game within the I spy or where's Waldo hidden object game family. You are given a series of objects and clues of where to find them on a small or large monochrome map with cute characters running around and distracting you. Some of the objects (if not most) will require you to solve a small puzzle such as opening a chest or finding a secret passage before you are able to find what you are looking for.

So another bias I have is that I love hidden object games, so I was going to like this game as long as it wasn't a broken mess. Fortunately it is a very well done, cute, and funny little game. The difficulty curve is controlled by small tutorial levels that introduce you to the mechanics and allowing the player to finish the next level with only a handful of the objects. It's also incredibly adorable, all of the sound effects are done by a person making silly sounding noises and it's wonderful. The art and animation are some of the cutest things you will see in games. 

So overall it is a lovely little game that is fun just to look for little things, and repeatedly click the alligator and hear that roar.

29963179.review:
Дуже цікава і оригінальна гра від інді-розробників. Хто колись шукав Вальдо на сторінках дитячих журналів — той зрозуміє.
Жанр "Пошук предметів" наразі почав повторювати себе, змінюючи лише сюжет, і ігри стали однотипними.

Але Hidden Folks зовсім інший:
- Все намальовано вручну і в дуже приємному стилі.
- Щоби знайти деяких людей (переважно тут потрібно шукати саме людей, folks), можна витратити купу часу.
- Взаємодіяти можна із 90% елементів на екрані. Саме так. Ви можете натискати на персонажів, об’єкти, дерева, кущі, ліани, крокодилів, птахів, будинки, двері, авто, вивіски, люки, хмари та багато чого ще.

Але є ще одна річ, яка з перших же хвилин захоплює: звуковий супровід. Усі звуки у грі були записані за допомогою… рота. Так, так. Зібралися люди, сіли перед мікрофонами, отримали список в руки, а там: озвучте крокодила, озвучте мавпу, озвучте двигун автомобіля, виїжджаючого реле, трансформаторної будки…

Ви тільки послухайте крокодила — це щось!!!

Рекомендую придбати, гра дає кілька годин насолодити, незважаючи на свою, здавалося б, простоту.

29963143.review:
(Précision : j'ai participé à la traduction du jeu)

Hidden Folks est un véritable plaisir :

- Les graphismes dessinés à la main sont non seulement charmants et originaux, ils apportent du défi grâce au noir et blanc en ne permettant pas à des détails colorés d'attirer particulièrement l’œil. Les animations des différents environnements apportent encore plus d'immersion dans la recherche, et on passe du temps à chercher les détails loufoques, l'attention portée à l'ensemble de la zone, etc...

- Les sons ont été enregistrés à la bouche et sont décalés, amusants, variés également et donnent envie d'explorer tout le décor afin d'en découvrir davantage.

- La prise en main est très simple, et le jeu n'est pas limité à une utilisation en solo puisque la recherche à plusieurs est tout aussi intéressante, que ce soit entre adultes ou avec des enfants, même très jeunes avec un bon accompagnement.

En bref, un bonheur pour les amateurs d'objets cachés et de dessin, et un bel objet vidéoludique pour tous !

hidden folks это неспешная уютная игра без большого сюжета, с кучей маленьких историй. по сути, всё, что нужно делать - искать человечков на анимированном экране. иногда, чтобы найти их, нужно что-нибудь подвинуть или включить. это идеальная игра для ленивого воскресного утра или отпуска. если вы сегодня куда-то спешите, то, возможно, hidden folks не для вас. 

большой плюс в том, что игра не торопит. не наказывает, когда вы кликаете слишком часто или вообще не туда. из минусов отмечу, что некоторые подсказки кажутся мне слишком сложными.

и, на всякий, если увидите неточности в переводе, то пишите, поправлю.

Великолепнейшая рисованная инди-игра, где Вам нужно искать людей, обезьян, различные объекты среди огромнейшего множества деталей. 

В этой игре Вам будет хотеться разглядывать всё и вся, рассматривать каждого персонажа, читать каждое описание объекта и тыкать на всё, что движется, и что не движется, ради забавнейших звуков и анимации!

Помимо рассматривания всяких деталей Вам нужно быть предельно внимательным в поисках некоторых предметов, так как порой это может быть очень сложно и нужно будет сохранять спокойствие, двигая карту по экрану раз за разом и вглядываясь в детали под приближением. Порадовало, что помимо простого поиска человечков нужно разгадать мини-загадки, надеюсь на новых картах такого будет больше!

В общем усаживайтесь поудобнее, берите лупу/линзы/монокль и рассматривайте этот рисованный мир! :)
10 бип-бип из 10!
